en: “My source told me that there are plans to lay a false trail; this must be it. No doubt a Confundus Charm has been placed upon Dawlish. It would not be the first time; he is known to be susceptible.”
vi: “Nguồn của tôi cho tôi biết là có những kế hoạch nghi binh; đây ắt là thế rồi. Chắc chắn là Dawlish đã bị ếm bùa Lú Lẫn. Đây không phải là lần đầu tiên; ai cũng biết hắn dễ mắc lừa.”
tr: "Kaynağım yanlış bir iz bırakmak için planlar olduğunu söyledi; bu o olmalı. Şüphesiz Dawlish‘e bir Kafa Karıştırma Büyüsü yapıldı. Bu ilk olmazdı; çevresindekilerden çabuk etkilenmesiyle tanınan biri.
es: —Mi'fuente ya me advirtió que planeaban dar una pista falsa; debe de ser ésa. No cabe duda de que a Dawlish le han hecho un encantamiento confundus. No sería la primera vez; todos sabemos que es muy vulnerable.
vi_translation: “My source tells me that there are decoy plans; this must be it. Surely Dawlish has been Confunded. This is not the first time; everyone knows he is easily fooled.”
tr_translation: "My source said there are plans to leave a false trail; it must be him. Undoubtedly, Dawlish was Confunded. This wouldn't be the first time; he is known for being easily influenced by those around him."
es_translation: —My source already warned me that they planned to give a false lead; it must be that one. There is no doubt that Dawlish has been put under a Confundus Charm. It wouldn't be the first time; we all know he is very vulnerable.

en: “My Lord, I have good news on that score. I have – with difficulty, and after great effort – succeeded in placing an Imperius Curse upon Pius Thicknesse.”
vi: “Thưa Chúa Tể, về việc đó tôi có tin lành. Tôi đã… vô cùng vất vả, và sau nỗ lực lớn lao… đã thành công trong việc ếm lời nguyền độc đoán lên Pius Thicknesse.
tr: "Lordum, o konuda iyi haberlerim var. Ben zorluklarla ve büyük bir uğraş sonucunda Pius Thicknesse üzerine İmperius Laneti yapmayı başardım.
es: —Mi señor, tengo buenas noticias a ese respecto. Con grandes dificultades y tras ímprobos esfuerzos, he conseguido hacerle una maldición imperius a Pius Thicknesse.
vi_translation: "My Lord, regarding that matter, I have good news. I have... with great difficulty, and after tremendous effort... succeeded in placing the Imperius Curse on Pius Thicknesse."
tr_translation: "My Lord, I have good news on that matter. After much difficulty and effort, I have succeeded in placing the Imperius Curse on Pius Thicknesse."
es_translation: —My lord, I have good news in that regard. With great difficulty and after tremendous efforts, I have managed to place an Imperius curse on Pius Thicknesse.

en: At these words, seemingly in response to them, a sudden wail sounded, a terrible, drawn-out cry of misery and pain. Many of those at the table looked downward, startled, for the sound had seemed to issue from below their feet.
vi: Dường như để đáp lại những lời này, một tiếng khóc thét thình lình rống lên, một tiếng sầu khổ và đau đớn khủng khiếp kéo dài. Nhiều người trong đám ngồi quanh bàn ngó xuống sàn, kinh ngạc, bởi vì âm thanh đó dường như phát ra từ phía dưới chân họ.
tr: Bu sözlerle birlikte, görünüşe bakılırsa ona cevap olarak, ani bir feryat sesi geldi; korkunç, acı bir haykırış. Masadakilerin birçoğu hayretle aşağı baktı, çünkü ses ayaklarının altından geliyormuş gibiydi.
es: En cuanto hubo pronunciado estas palabras y como en respuesta a ellas, se oyó un gemido desgarrador, un terrible y prolongadísimo alarido de angustia y dolor. Asustados, muchos de los presentes miraron el suelo, porque el sonido parecía provenir de debajo de sus pies.
vi_translation: As if in response to these words, a sudden scream erupted, a prolonged wail of sorrow and terrible pain. Many people sitting around the table looked down at the floor, astonished, because the sound seemed to come from beneath their feet.
tr_translation: With these words, apparently in response to him, came a sudden cry; a terrible, painful scream. Many of those at the table looked down in astonishment, for the sound seemed to be coming from beneath their feet.
es_translation: As soon as these words were spoken, and as if in response to them, a heart-wrenching moan was heard, a terrible and prolonged scream of anguish and pain. Frightened, many of those present looked at the ground, because the sound seemed to come from beneath their feet.

en: “Yes, m-my Lord,” gasped a small man halfway down the table, who had been sitting so low in his chair that it appeared, at first glance, to be unoccupied. Now he scrambled from his seat and scurried from the room, leaving nothing behind him but a curious gleam of silver.
vi: “Dạ, thưa… thưa Chúa Tể,” một người đàn ông nhỏ thó ngồi khoảng giữa bàn nói. Hắn ngồi lọt thỏm trong ghế, thấp đến nỗi thoáng nhìn qua cái ghế có vẻ như không có người ngồi. Giờ đây hắn lập cập rời khỏi chỗ, lật đật chạy ra khỏi phòng, chẳng để lại gì phía sau ngoại trừ một vết sáng bạc kỳ lạ.
tr: "Evet, Lordum," dedi, masanın ortalarında oturan ufak bir adam nefes nefese. Sandalyesinde o kadar alçakta oturuyorduki ilk bakışta sandalye boş gibi görünüyordu. O an yerinden fırladı ve ardında gümüşi, merak uyandıran bir parıltıdan başka bir şey bırakmadan aceleyle odadan dışarı çıktı.
es: —Sí, m... mi señor —respondió resollando un individuo bajito situado hacia la mitad de la mesa; estaba tan hundido en su silla que, a primera vista, ésta parecía desocupada. Se levantó del asiento y salió a toda prisa de la sala, dejando tras de sí un extraño resplandor plateado.
vi_translation: “Yes, my Lord… my Lord,” a small man sitting around the middle of the table said. He sat so deep in the chair, so short that at a glance it seemed like there was no one sitting in the chair. Now he shakily left his seat, hurriedly ran out of the room, leaving nothing behind except a strange silver streak.
tr_translation: "Yes, my Lord," said a small man sitting in the middle of the table, out of breath. He was sitting so low in his chair that at first glance it looked like the chair was empty. At that moment, he jumped up and hurried out of the room, leaving behind nothing but a silvery, intriguing shimmer.
es_translation: —Yes, m... my lord —responded a short individual, panting, situated towards the middle of the table; he was so sunk into his chair that, at first glance, it seemed unoccupied. He got up from the seat and hurried out of the room, leaving behind a strange silver glow.

en: “My Lord,” said a dark woman halfway down the table, her voice constricted with emotion, “it is an honor to have you here, in our family’s house. There can be no higher pleasure.”
vi: “Thưa Chúa Tể,” một người đàn bà u ám ngồi khoảng giữa cái bàn với giọng nói dồn nén cảm xúc, “chúng em rất vinh dự được đón ngài tại đây, trong gia đình chúng em. Không thể có niềm vui sướng nào lớn hơn được.”
tr: "Lordum," dedi masanın ortalarındaki karanlık bir kadın. Sesi duyguyla doluydu, "sizi burada, aile evimizde konuk etmek bir şeref. Daha üstün bir memnuniyet olamaz .
es: —Mi señor —dijo con voz emocionada una mujer morena situada hacia la mitad de la mesa—, es un honor alojaros aquí, en la casa de nuestra familia. Nada podría complacernos más.
vi_translation: "My Lord," said a somber woman sitting around the middle of the table with a voice filled with suppressed emotion, "we are very honored to welcome you here, in our family." "There can be no greater joy."
tr_translation: "My lord," said a dark woman from the middle of the table. Her voice was filled with emotion, "it is an honor to host you here, in our family home. There could be no greater satisfaction."
es_translation: —My lord —said a dark-haired woman situated towards the middle of the table with an emotional voice—, it is an honor to host you here, in our family's house. Nothing could please us more.

en: “Darling Dodgy! I remember interviewing him a few years back about merpeople rights, bless him. Completely gaga, seemed to think we were sitting at the bottom of Lake Windermere, kept telling me to watch out for trout.”
vi: “Dodgy đáng yêu thật! Tôi nhớ từng phỏng vấn ổng cách đây vài năm về ngư nhân quyền, trời đất ơi. Hoàn toàn lẩm cẩm, hình như ổng nghĩ chúng tôi đang ngồi dưới đáy hồ Windermere hay sao ấy, cứ bảo tôi phải coi chừng lũ cá hồi.”
tr: "Sevgili Dodgy! Birkaç yıl önce onunla deniz insanları hakları konusunda röportaj yaptığımı hatırlıyorum, tanrı onu korusun. Tamamen üşütük, Windermere Gölü‘nün dibinde oturduğumuzu sanıyor görünüyordu. Bana sürekli alabalıklara dikkat etmemi söyleyip durdu.
es: «¡El bueno de Dodgy! Recuerdo que hace unos años lo entrevisté acerca de los derechos de la gente del agua. ¡Pobre hombre! Estaba completamente ido; al parecer creía que nos hallábamos sentados en el fondo del lago Windermere, y no paraba de decirme que estuviera atenta por si veía alguna trucha.»
vi_translation: “Dodgy is really adorable! I remember interviewing him a few years ago about fishermen's rights, oh my god. Completely senile, it seemed like he thought we were sitting at the bottom of Lake Windermere or something, kept telling me to watch out for the salmon.”
tr_translation: "Dear Dodgy! I remember interviewing him about the rights of sea people a few years ago, God bless him. He seemed completely nuts, thinking we were sitting at the bottom of Lake Windermere. He kept telling me to watch out for the trout."
es_translation: "Good old Dodgy!" I remember that a few years ago I interviewed him about the rights of the water people. Poor man! He was completely gone; apparently, he believed that we were sitting at the bottom of Lake Windermere, and he kept telling me to watch out in case I saw any trout.

en: “Change of plan,” growled Mad-Eye, who was holding two enormous bulging sacks, and whose magical eye was spinning from darkening sky to house to garden with dizzying rapidity. “Let’s get undercover before we talk you through it.”
vi: “Kế hoạch có thay đổi,” Mắt-Điên làu bàu, thầy đang cầm hai bao gì phình căng bự chảng, và con mắt pháp thuật của thầy đảo từ bầu trời đang tối dần đến ngôi nhà rồi khu vườn với độ nhanh chóng mặt. “Bảo mật trước đã rồi giải thích mọi chuyện cho con sau.”
tr: "Plan değişikliği," diye hırladı Deli-Göz, elinde iki kocaman, şişkin torba taşıyordu ve sihirli gözü baş döndürücü bir hızla kararan gökyüzünden eve ve bahçeye kaymıştı. "Bunun hakkında konuşmadan önce korunaklı bir yere geçelim.
es: —Ha habido un cambio de planes —gruñó Ojoloco, que llevaba dos grandes sacos repletos y cuyo ojo mágico enfo-caba alternativamente el oscuro cielo, la casa y el jardín con una rapidez asombrosa—. Pongámonos a cubierto y luego te lo explicaremos todo.
vi_translation: “The plan has changed,” Mad-Eye grumbled, holding two large, bulging bags, and his magical eye darted from the darkening sky to the house and then the garden with astonishing speed. “Security first, explanations later.”
tr_translation: "Plan change," growled Mad-Eye, carrying two huge, bulging bags, and his magical eye had shifted from the rapidly darkening sky to the house and garden at a dizzying speed. "Let's move to a secure place before we talk about this."
es_translation: —There has been a change of plans —growled Mad-Eye, who was carrying two large stuffed sacks and whose magical eye was alternately focusing on the dark sky, the house, and the garden with astonishing speed—. Let's take cover and then we'll explain everything to you.

en: “You’ll be going to Tonks’s parents. Once you’re within the boundaries of the protective enchantments we’ve put on their house you’ll be able to use a Portkey to the Burrow. Any questions?”
vi: “Con sẽ đến nhà cha mẹ cô Tonks. Một khi đã ở trong vòng linh nghiệm của bùa phép bảo vệ mà chúng ta ếm lên căn nhà, con sẽ có thể dùng Khóa Cảng để đến Hang Sóc. Có thắc mắc gì không?”
tr: "Sen Tonks‘un anne ve babasına gideceksin. Bir kere onların evine koyduğumuz koruyucu büyülerin sınırına girdiğin zaman, Kovuk‘a gitmek için bir anahtar kullanabileceksin. Sorun var mı?
es: —Muy bien. Pues irás a la casa de los padres de Tonks. Cuando te encuentres dentro de los límites de los sortilegios protectores que hemos puesto en esa casa, podrás utilizar un traslador para llegar a La Madriguera. ¿Alguna pregunta?
vi_translation: “You will go to Tonks' parents' house. Once you are within the protective enchantments we placed on the house, you will be able to use a Portkey to get to the Burrow. Any questions?”
tr_translation: "You will go to Tonks' mother and father. Once you enter the boundary of the protective spells we placed on their house, you will be able to use a portkey to go to the Burrow. Is there a problem?"
es_translation: —Very well. Then you will go to Tonks' parents' house. When you find yourself within the boundaries of the protective enchantments we have placed on that house, you will be able to use a Portkey to get to The Burrow. Any questions?

en: The broomstick spun too, but he just managed to seize the strap of his rucksack and the top of the cage as the motorbike swung the right way up again. A second's relief, and then another burst of green light. The owl screeched and fell to the floor of the cage.
vi: Cây chổi bay mòng mòng xuống đất, nhưng nó chỉ xoay sở túm được cái đai của ba lô và cái nóc lồng khi chiếc xe gắn máy xoay trở về vị trí ban đầu. Mới hú vía được một giây thì một đợt lửa xanh lè khác lại bùng lên. Con cú rít lên và ngã lăn quay xuống đáy lồng.
tr: Süpürge yeryüzüne fırladı, fakat motosiklet aynı şekilde yukarı doğru çıkmaya başlarken sırt çantasının kayışından ve kafesin üstünden yakalamayı başardı. Bir anlığına içi rahatlamıştı ama hemen sonra başka bir yeşil ışık patladı. Baykuş acı ve tiz bir şekilde öttü ve kafesin zeminine düştü .
es: La escoba cayó girando sobre sí misma, pero Harry consiguió atrapar el asa de la mochila y sujetar la jaula, al mismo tiempo que la motocicleta volvía a girar y se coloca-ba en la posición correcta. Hubo un segundo de alivio... y luego otro destello de luz verde. La lechuza chilló y se desplomó en la jaula.
vi_translation: The broom swooped down to the ground, but it only managed to grab the strap of the backpack and the top of the cage when the motorcycle returned to its original position. Just a second after the scare, another burst of green flames flared up. The owl screeched and fell to the bottom of the cage.
tr_translation: The broom flew to the ground, but as the motorcycle began to rise in the same way, he managed to catch it by the strap of the backpack and the top of the cage. For a moment, he felt relieved, but then another green light flashed. The owl hooted in pain and fell to the bottom of the cage.
es_translation: The broom fell spinning on itself, but Harry managed to grab the handle of the backpack and hold onto the cage, at the same time as the motorcycle spun back and positioned itself correctly. There was a second of relief... and then another flash of green light. The owl screeched and collapsed in the cage.

en: “Well, we know our protective charms hold, then, don't we? They shouldn't be able to get within a hundred yards of the place in any direction.”
vi: “Lạ, chúng ta biết bùa bảo vệ vẫn còn linh nghiệm mà, đúng không? Bọn chúng không thể nào xâm nhập phạm vi một trăm thước quanh địa điểm này từ bất cứ hướng nào.”
tr: "Koruyucu büyülerimizin devam ettiğini biliyoruz o zaman, değil mi? Yapılan noktaya yüz metre bile yaklaşamamaları gerekir.
es: —Bueno, eso significa que nuestros encantamientos protectores funcionan, ¿no? De modo que, en teoría, los mortífagos no pueden acercarse a esta casa en un radio de cien metros, desde ninguna dirección.
vi_translation: "Strange, we know the protective charm is still effective, don't we? They can't penetrate within a hundred yards of this location from any direction."
tr_translation: "We know that our protective spells are still in effect, right? They shouldn't be able to get within a hundred meters of the designated point."
es_translation: —Well, that means our protective enchantments are working, right? So, in theory, the Death Eaters can't approach this house within a hundred meters radius, from any direction.

en: He could hear the self-justifying note in his voice, the plea for her to understand why he did not know what had happened to her sons, but –
vi: Nó nghe thấy sự phân trần trong giọng nói của mình, khẩn khoản xin bà thông cảm vì sao nó không biết chuyện gì xảy ra cho các con trai của bà, nhưng…
tr: Sesindeki kendini yargılayan havayı duyabiliyordu, oğullarına ne olduğunu neden bilmediğini anlaması için özür diliyor gibiydi, ama-
es: Harry se dio cuenta de que su voz tenía un deje suplicante, como si intentara justificarse o hacerle entender a Molly por qué no sabía qué suerte habían corrido sus hijos, pero...
vi_translation: It heard the explanation in its voice, pleading for her understanding as to why it didn't know what had happened to her sons, but...
tr_translation: He could hear the self-judging tone in his voice, as if he were apologizing for not knowing what had happened to his sons, but-
es_translation: Harry realized that his voice had a pleading tone, as if he were trying to justify himself or make Molly understand why he didn't know what fate had befallen his children, but...

en: The minutes stretched into what might as well have been years. The slightest breath of wind made them all jump and turn toward the whispering bush or tree in the hope that one of the missing Order members might leap unscathed from its leaves –
vi: Từng phút dài ra như cả năm trường. Làn gió thoảng nhẹ nhất cũng khiến tất cả giật mình hướng về phía lùm bụi hay cây cỏ lao xao, hy vọng một trong những Hội viên có thể từ trong đám lá nhảy ra bình yên vô sự…
tr: Dakikalar sanki yıllar gibi geçmişti. Rüzgârın en hafif esintisiyle bile içleri cız ediyor ve sanki eksik olan Yoldaşlık üyeleri yaralanmamış halde yaprakların arasından fırlayacakmış gibi her fısıldayan ağaca ya da çalıya dönüyorlardı.
es: Los minutos transcurrían con una lentitud insoportable. De repente, un leve susurro los sobresaltó, y todos se giraron para comprobar si se había movido algún arbusto o un árbol, con la esperanza de ver asomar entre su follaje, ileso, a otro miembro de la Orden.
vi_translation: Each minute stretched out like a whole year. The slightest breeze made everyone startle and look towards the rustling bushes or grass, hoping that one of the members might jump out from the leaves safe and sound...
tr_translation: Minutes had passed as if they were years. Even the slightest breeze made their hearts ache, and they turned to every whispering tree or bush as if the missing Fellowship members would emerge unscathed from the leaves.
es_translation: The minutes passed with unbearable slowness. Suddenly, a faint whisper startled them, and they all turned to see if any bush or tree had moved, hoping to see another member of the Order emerge unscathed from its foliage.

en: “Here,” he said, and with a wave of his wand, eh sent twelve full glasses soaring through the room to each of them, holding the thirteenth aloft. “Mad-Eye.”
vi: “Đây,” anh nói, và với một cái vẫy cây đũa phép, anh phát mười hai ly rượu đầy bay vụt ngang phòng đến từng người, anh giơ cao ly rượu thứ mười ba, “Mắt-Điên. “Mắt-Điên,” tất cả cùng hô, và uống.
tr: "İşte," dedi ve asasının bir hareketiyle tamamen dolu on iki bardak havada süzülüp odadakilere gitti, ardından on üçüncüyü yukarı kaldırdı. "Deli-Göz‘e.
es: —Brindemos —propuso, y con una sacudida de la varita hizo volar los doce vasos llenos por la habitación hasta cada uno de los presentes; cogió el suyo y lo levantó—. ¡Por Ojoloco!
vi_translation: "Here," he said, and with a wave of his wand, he sent twelve full glasses of wine flying across the room to each person, he raised the thirteenth glass, "Mad-Eye."" "Mad-Eye," they all shouted, and drank.
tr_translation: "Here," he said, and with a flick of his wand, twelve completely filled glasses floated through the air to the people in the room, then he raised the thirteenth one. "To Mad-Eye.""
es_translation: —Let's toast —he proposed, and with a flick of his wand, he made the twelve full glasses fly across the room to each of those present; he took his own and raised it—. To Mad-Eye! —For Mad-Eye!

en: No one said anything. He knew that they did not believe him. Now that he came to think of it, he had never heard of a wand performing magic on its own before.
vi: Không ai nói gì. Nó biết là họ không tin nó. Bây giờ nó bắt đầu nghĩ lại, trước đây nó chưa hề nghe nói đến một cây đũa phép tự ý làm phép một mình.
tr: Kimse bir şey söylemedi. Ona inanmadıklarını biliyordu. Düşününce, kendisi de kendiliğinden büyü yapan bir asa hiç duymamıştı.
es: Nadie insistió, pero Harry sabía que no le creían. Y la verdad era que nunca había oído decir que una varita hiciera magia por su cuenta.
vi_translation: No one said anything. It knew that they did not believe it. Now it began to reconsider, it had never heard of a wand performing magic on its own before.
tr_translation: Nobody said anything. She knew they didn't believe her. When she thought about it, she herself had never heard of a wand that performed magic on its own.
es_translation: Nobody insisted, but Harry knew they didn't believe him. And the truth was that he had never heard of a wand performing magic on its own.

en: His scar seared with pain, it was all he could do not to moan aloud. Muttering about fresh air, he set down his glass and left the room.
vi: Cái thẹo của nó nhói đau, nó cố gắng hết sức mới không rên la. Lẩm bẩm gì đó về khí trời trong lành, nó đặt cái ly xuống và bỏ ra khỏi phòng.
tr: Yarası acıyla dağlandı; tek yapabildiği yüksek sesle inlememekti. Temiz havayla ilgili bir şeyler homurdanarak bardağını bıraktı ve odayı terk etti.
es: El dolor de la cicatriz era cada vez más intenso y ya apenas podía contener los gemidos. Dijo que necesitaba tomar el aire, dejó su vaso y salió de la habitación.
vi_translation: Its scar throbbed with pain, it tried its best not to groan. Muttering something about the fresh air, it put the glass down and left the room.
tr_translation: His wound was seared with pain; all he could do was refrain from crying out loudly. Muttering something about the fresh air, he put down his glass and left the room.
es_translation: The pain from the scar was becoming more intense, and he could barely contain his groans. He said he needed to get some air, left his glass, and walked out of the room.

en: “As we knew he would,” she sighed, turning back to the books. “You know, I think I will take Hogwarts, A History. Even if we’re not going back there, I don’t think I’d feel right if I didn’t have it with –“
vi: “Thì tụi mình đã biết là nó sẽ nói mà,” cô bé thở dài, quay về với những cuốn sách. “Bồ biết không, mình nghĩ mình sẽ đem theo cuốn Hogwarts, Một Lịch Sử. Cho dù tụi mình không trở về nơi đó nữa, mình nghĩ mình sẽ cảm thấy không phải nếu không mang nó theo cùng…”
tr: "Tahmin ettiğimiz gibi," diye iç çekti kız ve tekrar kitaplara döndü. "Biliyor musunuz, sanırım “Hogwarts: Bir Tarih”i alacağım. Oraya yeniden dönmeyeceksek bile, bu kitap olmadan rahat hissedeceğimi sanmıyorum -"
es: —Tal como temíamos —suspiró ella, y siguió con los libros—. Mirad, creo que sí me llevaré Historia de Hogwarts. Aunque no vayamos al colegio, me sentiría muy rara si no lo...
vi_translation: “We knew it would say that,” the girl sighed, turning back to her books. “You know, I think I'll bring Hogwarts, A History with me. Even if we don't go back there anymore, I think I'd feel wrong not taking it along…”
tr_translation: "As we suspected," sighed the girl and turned back to the books. "You know, I think I will take 'Hogwarts: A History.' Even if we are not going back there, I don't think I will feel comfortable without this book -"
es_translation: —Just as we feared —she sighed, and continued with the books—. Look, I think I will take Hogwarts: A History. Even if we don't go to school, I would feel very strange if we didn't...

en: “I’m so sorry to break up this cozy little gathering,” she said, her voice trembling. “I’m sure you all need your rest . . . but there are wedding presents stacked in my room that need sorting out and I was under the impression that you had agreed to help.”
vi: “Tôi rất tiếc phải giải tán cuộc họp mặt thân ái nho nhỏ này,” bà nói giọng run run, “Tôi biết là tất cả các anh chị cần nghỉ ngơi… nhưng quà cưới còn chất đống trong phòng tôi giờ cần phải sắp xếp, mà tôi lại cứ có cảm tưởng là các anh chị đã đồng ý giúp đỡ rồi chớ.”
tr: "Bu sıcak, küçük buluşmayı böldüğüm için özür dilerim," dedi, sesi titriyordu. "Eminim hepinizin dinlenmeye ihtiyacı var... ama odamda ayrıştırılmayı bekleyen bir yığın düğün hediyesi var ve sizin bana yardım etmek istediğinizi sanıyordum.
es: —Lamento mucho interrumpir esta agradable tertulia —dijo con voz temblorosa—. Ya sé que todos necesitáis descansar, pero en mi habitación hay un montón de regalos de boda que deben clasificarse, y se me ha ocurrido que a lo mejor querríais ayudarme.
vi_translation: “I am very sorry to have to disband this small friendly gathering,” she said in a trembling voice, “I know that all of you need to rest... but the wedding gifts are still piled up in my room and need to be sorted, and I have the impression that all of you have already agreed to help.”
tr_translation: "I'm sorry to interrupt this warm, little gathering," she said, her voice trembling. "I'm sure you all need some rest... but there's a pile of wedding gifts waiting to be sorted in my room, and I thought you wanted to help me.""
es_translation: —I am very sorry to interrupt this pleasant gathering —he said with a trembling voice—. I know that everyone needs to rest, but in my room there are a lot of wedding gifts that need to be sorted, and I thought that maybe you would like to help me.

en: He was walking along a mountain road in the cool blue light of dawn. Far below, swathed in mist, was the shadow of a small town. Was the man he sought down there, the man he needed so badly he could think of little else, the man who held the answer, the answer to his problem...?
vi: Nó đang đi dọc theo một con đường núi trong ánh bình minh màu xanh dịu mát. Xa xa bên dưới, phủ trong sương mù, lờ mờ hình ảnh một thị trấn nhỏ. Người đàn ông nó đang tìm có ở dưới đó không, người đàn ông nó cần ghê gớm đến nỗi nó không thể nghĩ đến chút gì khác, người đàn ông nắm lời giải - lời giải cho vấn đề của nó…
tr: Gün doğumunun serin mavi ışığı altında, bir dağ yolu boyunca yürüyordu. Uzaklarda bir yerde, sisle kaplanmış, küçük bir köyün gölgesi vardı. Aradığı adam burada mıydı; başka en ufak bir şey düşünemeyecek kadar fena halde ihtiyaç duyduğu adam, cevabının sahibi olan adam, derdine derman olacak adam...
es: Iba caminando por una carretera de montaña bajo la fría y azulada luz del amanecer. En la distancia, un poco más abajo, se distinguía el contorno de un pueblecito envuelto en la neblina. ¿Estaría allí el hombre al que buscaba? El hombre al que tanto necesitaba que casi no podía pensar en otra cosa, el hombre que tenía la solución a su problema.
vi_translation: It was walking along a mountain road in the gentle cool blue dawn. Far below, shrouded in mist, the faint image of a small town appeared. The man it was looking for, the man it needed so desperately that it couldn't think of anything else, the man who held the solution - the solution to its problem, was he down there?
tr_translation: Under the cool blue light of dawn, he was walking along a mountain path. Somewhere in the distance, there was the shadow of a small village shrouded in mist. Was the man he was looking for here; the man he desperately needed, the man who held the answer, the man who would be the remedy to his troubles...?
es_translation: I was walking along a mountain road under the cold, bluish light of dawn. In the distance, a little further down, the outline of a small village shrouded in mist could be seen. Was the man he was looking for there? The man he needed so much that he could hardly think of anything else, the man who had the solution to his problem.

en: “I think,” he said slowly, “he's got something to do with Quidditch. There's some connection, but I can't--I can't think what it is.”
vi: “Mình nghĩ,” nó nói chậm rãi, “ắt có dính dáng tới Quidditch. Có mối liên quan, nhưng mình không thể… mình không thể nghĩ ra nó là cái gì.”
tr: "Düşünüyorum ki," dedi yavaşça, Quidditch‘le alakalı birisi. Bir bağlantı var, ama ben bilemiyorum- bilemiyorum ne olduğunu.
es: Yo diría —comentó con lentitud— que tiene algo que ver con el quidditch. Hay alguna relación, pero no sé... no sé cuál.
vi_translation: “I think,” it said slowly, “it must be related to Quidditch. There is a connection, but I can't… I can't figure out what it is.”
tr_translation: "I think," said someone slowly, related to Quidditch. There is a connection, but I don't know- I don't know what it is."
es_translation: I would say —he commented slowly— that it has something to do with Quidditch. There is some connection, but I don't know... I don't know which one.

en: Brightly colored figures were appearing, one by one out of nowhere at the distant boundary of the yard. Within minutes a procession had formed, which began to snake its way up through the garden toward the marquee. Exotic flowers and bewitched birds fluttered on the witches’ hats, while precious gems glittered from many of the wizards’ cravats; a hum of excited chatter grew louder and louder, drowning the sound of the bees as the crowd approached the tent.
vi: Những hình dáng màu sắc rực rỡ đang hiện ra, từng bóng một, đột ngột, ở ranh giới xa xa của khu vườn. Trong một loáng, họ hình thành một đám rước bắt đầu rồng rắn kéo nhau qua khu vườn về phía rạp cưới. Kỳ hoa và dị điểu được ếm bùa chấp chới bay trên nón các nữ phù thủy, trong khi ngọc quý lấp lánh chiếu ra từ cà vạt các pháp sư; tiếng trò chuyện râm ran hào hứng càng lúc càng to, át hết tiếng bầy ong, khi đám rước đến gần rạp.
tr: Arazinin sınırında yokluktan tek tek parlak renkli figürler beliriyordu. Hemen ardından bir dakika içinde bahçedeki çadıra doğru gelmeye başladılar. Egzotik çiçekler ve büyülenmiş kuşlar cadıların şapkalarının üstünden sallanırken, büyücülerin de kravatlarındaki mücevher işlemeler parlıyordu; çadıra yaklaştıkça etraftan arıların seslerini boğan heyecanlı konuşma sesleri yükseliyordu.
es: Unos personajes vestidos con llamativas ropas multicolores iban apareciendo, uno a uno, por el fondo del patio. Pasados unos minutos, ya se había formado una procesión que serpenteó por el jardín en dirección a la carpa. En los sombreros de las brujas revoloteaban flores exóticas y pá- jaros embrujados, mientras que preciosas gemas destellaban en las corbatas de muchos magos. A medida que se aproximaban, el murmullo de voces emocionadas fue intensificándose, hasta ahogar el zumbido de las abejas.
vi_translation: Vividly colored shapes are appearing, one by one, suddenly, at the distant boundary of the garden. In a flash, they form a procession that begins to snake through the garden towards the wedding pavilion. Enchanted exotic flowers and birds flutter above the witches' hats, while precious gems sparkle from the wizards' ties; the excited chatter grows louder, drowning out the buzzing of the bees, as the procession approaches the pavilion.
tr_translation: At the edge of the land, bright-colored figures were emerging one by one from the void. Immediately after, within a minute, they started heading towards the tent in the garden. As exotic flowers and enchanted birds swayed above the witches' hats, the jeweled embroideries on the wizards' ties sparkled; as they approached the tent, the excited chatter drowned out the buzzing of the bees around.
es_translation: Some characters dressed in striking multicolored clothes were appearing, one by one, at the back of the courtyard. After a few minutes, a procession had already formed that wound through the garden towards the tent. Exotic flowers fluttered on the witches' hats and pa- haunted jars, while precious gems sparkled on the ties of many wizards. As they approached, the murmur of excited voices grew louder, drowning out the buzzing of the bees.

en: “I’ve no idea, it just popped into my head, but I’m sure we’re safer out in the Muggle world, it’s not where they’ll expect us to be.”
vi: “Mình không biết, chẳng qua nó chợt nảy ra trong đầu mình, nhưng chắc chắn là trong thế giới Muggle tụi mình sẽ an toàn hơn, bọn chúng sẽ không ngờ tụi mình tới đây.”
tr: "Hiçbir fikrim yok, sadece aklıma geldi, fakat eminim ki bizim olmamızı beklemedikleri yerde, Muggle dünyasında daha güvendeyiz.
es: Me vino a la cabeza, sin más, pero creí que estaríamos más seguros en el mundo de los muggles, porque aquí no se les ocurrirá buscarnos.
vi_translation: "I don't know, it just suddenly popped into my head, but surely in the Muggle world we will be safer, they won't expect us to come here."
tr_translation: "I have no idea, it just came to my mind, but I'm sure we are safer where they don't expect us to be, in the Muggle world."
es_translation: It just came to my mind, nothing more, but I thought we would be safer in the Muggle world, because they wouldn't think to look for us here.

en: “I say we find a quiet place to Disapparate and head for the countryside. Once we’re there, we could send a message to the Order.”
vi: “Mình đề nghị tụi mình kiếm một chỗ Độn thổ ra vùng quê. Khi ra tới đó rồi, tụi mình có thể gởi thư cho Hội.”
tr: "Diyorum ki Buharlaşmak için sakin bir mekân bulalım ve kırsal bölgeye yönelelim. Oraya ulaştıktan sonra, Yoldaşlık‘a mesaj gönderebiliriz.
es: —Propongo que busquemos un sitio tranquilo donde desaparecernos y nos vayamos al campo. Entonces podremos enviarle un mensaje a la Orden.
vi_translation: “I suggest we find a place to Apparate to the countryside. Once we get there, we can send a letter to the Order.”
tr_translation: "I say let's find a quiet place to Evaporate and head towards the countryside. After we get there, we can send a message to the Fellowship."
es_translation: —I propose that we find a quiet place where we can disappear and go to the countryside. Then we can send a message to the Order.

en: “‘Recent research undertaken by the Department of Mysteries reveals that magic can only be passed from person to person when Wizards reproduce. Where no proven Wizarding ancestry exists, therefore, the so-called Muggle-born is likely to have obtained magical power by theft or force.
vi: “Nghiên cứu gần đây do Sở Bí Mật thực hiện cho thấy pháp thuật chỉ có thể truyền từ cá nhân sang cá nhân khi phù thủy sinh sản. Vì vậy, một khi không chứng minh được dòng dõi phù thủy, kẻ-gọi-là phù thủy gốc Muggle rất có thể đã có được quyền năng pháp thuật bằng cách trộm cắp hay cưỡng đoạt.
tr: "Yakındaki soruşturma, büyünün yalnızca büyücüler üreyince kişiden kişiye geçtiği belirtilerek Esrar Dairesi tarafından üstlenildi. Kanıtlanmış büyücü ataları olmadığına göre, Muggle-doğumlu denenler, büyü gücünü hırsızlık yoluyla ya da zor kullanarak almışlardır.
es: Una investigación reciente realizada por el Departamento de Misterios revela que la magia sólo puede transmitirse entre magos mediante la re-producción. Por lo tanto, si no existen antepasados mágicos comprobados, es posible que los llamados «hijos de muggles» hayan obtenido sus poderes má- gicos por medios ilícitos, como el robo o el empleo de la fuerza.
vi_translation: “Recent research conducted by the Department of Mysteries shows that magic can only be passed from individual to individual when a witch or wizard reproduces. Therefore, if one cannot prove their wizarding lineage, so-called Muggle-born witches and wizards very likely obtained their magical powers through theft or coercion.
tr_translation: "The nearby investigation was undertaken by the Department of Mysteries, stating that magic is passed from person to person only when wizards reproduce. Since they have no proven wizard ancestors, those called Muggle-born must have acquired their magical power through theft or coercion.
es_translation: A recent investigation conducted by the Department of Mysteries reveals that magic can only be transmitted between wizards through reproduction. Therefore, if there are no proven magical ancestors, it is possible that the so-called "muggle-borns" have obtained their powers ma- goods by illicit means, such as theft or the use of force.

en: “You have only ever seen me amongst the Order, or under Dumbledore’s protection at Hogwarts! You don’t know how most of the Wizarding world sees creatures like me! When they know of my affliction, they can barely talk to me! Don’t you see what I’ve done?
vi: “Các người chỉ nhìn thấy tôi ở trong Hội, hay dưới sự che chở của cụ Dumbledore ở trường Hogwarts! Các người không biết phần lớn thế giới pháp thuật nhìn những sinh vật như chúng tôi như thế nào! Khi họ biết cái họa mà tôi phải mang, họ không thể nào vô tư nói chuyện với tôi! Các người không thấy tôi đã làm gì sao?
tr: "Beni yalnızca Yoldaşlık içinde gördünüz, ya da Hogwarts‘ta Dumbledore‘un koruması altında! Büyücülük dünyasının çoğunluğunun benim gibi yaratıkları ne olarak gördüklerini bilmiyorsunuz! Sıkıntımı öğrendikleri zaman benimle zar zor konuşuyorlar! Ne yaptığımı görmüyor musunuz?
es: ¡Tú sólo me has visto rodeado de miembros de la Orden, o en Hogwarts, bajo la protección de Dumbledore! ¡Pero no sabes qué piensa la mayoría del mundo mágico de las criaturas como yo! ¡Los que conocen mi condición apenas me dirigen la palabra! ¿No te das cuenta de lo que he hecho?
vi_translation: “You only see me in the Order, or under Dumbledore's protection at Hogwarts! You don't know how most of the wizarding world views creatures like us! When they know the curse I bear, they can't casually talk to me! Don't you see what I've done?”
tr_translation: "You have only seen me within the Order, or under Dumbledore's protection at Hogwarts! You don't know what the majority of the wizarding world sees creatures like me as! When they learn about my condition, they barely speak to me! Don't you see what I'm doing?
es_translation: You've only seen me surrounded by members of the Order, or at Hogwarts, under Dumbledore's protection! But you don't know what the majority of the magical world thinks of creatures like me! Those who know my condition barely speak to me! Don't you realize what I've done?

en: “Well then, why the ‘ell am I being ‘unted down by ‘ouse-elves? Or is this about them goblets again? I ain’t got none of ‘em left, or you could ‘ave ‘em –”
vi: “Vậy thì mắc cái quỷ gì mà tôi bị bọn gia tinh săn lùng chớ? Hay lại chuyện về mấy cái cốc? Tôi không còn giữ cái nào nữa, nếu còn các người cứ lấy…”
tr: "Öyleyse neden ev cinleri tarafından kovalanıyorum? Yoksa bu yine o kadehlerle mi alakalı? Bende hiç kalmadı, eğer kalmış olsaydı hepsini alabilirdiniz-"
es: —Entonces, ¿por qué demonios me ha traído aquí ese elfo doméstico? ¿Es otra vez por lo de las copas ésas? No me queda ni una; si las tuviera os las daría...
vi_translation: “So why on earth am I being hunted by house-elves? Is it about those goblets again? I don't have any left, if I did, you could take them…”
tr_translation: "Then why am I being chased by house elves? Or is this about those goblets again? I don't have any left, if I did, you could have taken them all-"
es_translation: —Then, why on earth did that house-elf bring me here? Is it about those cups again? I don't have a single one left; if I had them, I would give them to you...

en: As August wore on, the square of unkempt grass in the middle of Grimmauld Place shriveled in the sun until it was brittle and brown. The inhabitants of number twelve were never seen by anyone in the surrounding houses, and nor was number twelve itself. The muggles who lived in Grimmauld Place had long since accepted the amusing mistake in the numbering that had caused number eleven to sit beside number thirteen.
vi: Đến cuối tháng tám, vuông sân cỏ mọc tùm lum ở giữa quảng trường Grimmauld đã héo queo trong nắng đến mức giòn rụm và nâu xỉn. Cư dân trong ngôi nhà số mười hai hoàn toàn vô hình dưới mắt những người sống trong những ngôi nhà chung quanh. Bản thân ngôi nhà số mười hai cũng vô hình. Từ lâu dân Muggle sống ở quảng trường Grimmauld đã chấp nhận sự nhầm lẫn thú vị trong việc đánh số nhà khiến cho nhà số mười một nằm ngay cạnh nhà số mười ba.
tr: Ağustos yavaşça geçtiğinde, Grimmauld Meydanı‘nın ortasındaki bakımsız çimler güneşte gevrekleşene kadar pörsüdü ve sarardı. Ne On İki Numara‘nın sakinleri ne de On İki Numara'nın kendisi, civar evlerde yaşayan bir kimse tarafından görülüyordu. Grimmauld Meydanı‘nda yaşayan Muggle‘lar çoktan “On Bir” numaranın yanında “On Üç” numaranın yer almasının komik bir hata olduğunu kabullenmişlerdi.
es: A medida que avanzaba agosto, el descuidado rectángulo de césped que había en el centro de Grimmauld Place iba marchitándose al sol hasta quedar reseco y marrón. Los muggles que vivían en las casas vecinas de esa plaza nunca habían visto a los inquilinos del número 12 ni la casa en sí, pero hacía mucho tiempo que habían aceptado el gracioso error de numeración, en virtud del cual los números 11 y 13 eran colindantes.
vi_translation: By the end of August, the patch of grass growing wildly in the middle of Grimmauld Square had withered in the sun to the point of becoming brittle and dull brown. The residents of number twelve were completely invisible to those living in the surrounding houses. The house number twelve itself was also invisible. The Muggles living in Grimmauld Place have long accepted the curious numbering error that places house number eleven right next to house number thirteen.
tr_translation: As August slowly passed, the neglected grass in the middle of Grimmauld Place withered and turned yellow until it crisped in the sun. Neither the residents of Number Twelve nor Number Twelve itself were seen by anyone living in the surrounding houses. The Muggles living in Grimmauld Place had long accepted that the presence of "Number Thirteen" next to "Number Eleven" was a comical mistake.
es_translation: As August progressed, the neglected rectangle of grass in the center of Grimmauld Place withered under the sun until it became dry and brown. The Muggles who lived in the neighboring houses of that square had never seen the occupants of number 12 nor the house itself, but they had long accepted the amusing numbering error, by virtue of which numbers 11 and 13 they were adjacent.

en: And yet the square was now attracting a trickle of visitors who seemed to find the anomaly most intriguing. Barely a day passed without one or two people arriving in Grimmauld Place with no other purpose, or so it seemed, than to lean against the railings facing numbers eleven and thirteen, watching the join between the two houses. The lurkers were never the same two days running, although they all seemed to share a dislike for normal clothing. Most of the Londoners who passed them were used to eccentric dressers and took little notice, though occasionally one of them might glance back, wondering why anyone would wear cloaks in this heat.
vi: Ấy vậy mà cái quảng trường đó giờ đây cũng thu hút được một nhúm khách tham quan, những người có vẻ phát hiện ra cái sự không bình thường đó rất ư hấp dẫn. Hiếm có một ngày nào mà không có một hay hai người đến quảng trường Grimmauld chỉ với mục đích (hay có vẻ như với mục đích) đứng dựa vào hàng rào song sắt đối diện nhà số mười một và nhà số mười ba, quan sát chỗ giáp vách giữa hai căn nhà. Mấy tay rình rập đó khác nhau mỗi ngày, mặc dù tất cả dường như có chung cái tính không ưa ăn mặc bình thường. Hầu hết dân Luân Đôn đã quen thấy những người ăn mặc lập dị nên khi đi ngang qua mấy tay đó cũng chẳng thèm để ý đến nữa, nhưng thỉnh thoảng cũng có người liếc nhìn lại, thắc mắc sao lại có người trùm áo choàng trong thời tiết nóng bức thế này.
tr: Yine de meydan, hâlâ merak verici anormallikte olan birkaç ziyaretçi çekiyordu. Günde en az bir ya da iki insan sırf ya bu sebepten dolayı Grimmauld Meydanı‘na geliyor, ya da en azından bu sebepten gelmiş gibi görünüyor, yüzlerini “On Bir” ve “On Üç” numaralarına vererek parmaklıklara yaslanıyorlar ve iki evin birleşme noktasını izliyorlardı. Pusuya yatanlar hiç iki gün üst üste aynı değillerdi ve bununla beraber hepsinin de ortak noktasının düzgün bir kıyafetten nefret ettikleri olduğu görünüyordu. Yanlarından geçen Londralılar'ın büyük bölümü bunları eksantrik giysiler olarak görüyor ve bir bakıp geçiyor, yine de bazen bir tanesi neden bir insanın bu sıcakta bu tür bir cüppe giyebileceğini merak edip dönüp tekrar bakıyordu.
es: Y sin embargo, la plaza atraía un goteo de visitantes que, por lo visto, consideraban esa anomalía de lo más intrigante. Así pues, no pasaba ni un día sin que una o dos personas llegaran a Grimmauld Place con el único propósito (al menos aparentemente) de apoyarse en la pequeña valla que cercaba la plaza, frente a los números 11 y 13, y observar la unión de las dos casas. Esos individuos nunca eran los mismos, aunque todos solían vestir de una forma muy rara. La mayoría de los londinenses que pasaban por allí, acostumbrados a ver personajes excéntricos, no se fijaban mucho en ellos, aunque de vez en cuando algún viandante volvía la cabeza y se preguntaba cómo se le ocurría a alguien salir a la calle con una capa tan larga, visto el calor que hacía.
vi_translation: Yet that square now attracts a handful of visitors, people who seem to find that abnormality very appealing. It is rare for a day to pass without one or two people coming to Grimmauld Square with the sole purpose (or seemingly with the purpose) of leaning against the iron fence opposite numbers eleven and thirteen, observing the junction between the two houses. These lurkers are different each day, although they all seem to share a common dislike for dressing normally. Most Londoners are accustomed to seeing eccentrically dressed people, so they no longer pay attention when passing by these lurkers, but occasionally someone will glance back, wondering why anyone would wear a cloak in such hot weather.
tr_translation: Nevertheless, the square still attracted a few visitors of curious abnormality. At least one or two people a day came to Grimmauld Place just for this reason, or at least seemed to come for this reason, leaning against the railings with their faces turned towards numbers "Eleven" and "Thirteen" and watching the junction of the two houses. The lurkers were never the same two days in a row, and it seemed that all of them shared a common dislike for proper attire. The majority of passing Londoners saw these as eccentric outfits and glanced briefly before moving on, though sometimes one would wonder why a person would wear such a robe in this heat and turn back for another look.
es_translation: And yet, the square attracted a trickle of visitors who, apparently, found this anomaly most intriguing. Thus, not a day went by without one or two people arriving at Grimmauld Place with the sole purpose (at least apparently) of leaning on the small fence that enclosed the square, in front of numbers 11 and 13, and observing the junction of the two houses. These individuals were never the same, although they all tended to dress in a very peculiar manner. Most Londoners passing by, accustomed to seeing eccentric characters, didn't pay much attention to them, although occasionally a passerby would turn their head and wonder how anyone could think of going out with such a long cloak, given the heat.

en: “No – no!” He choked and retched, trying to continue on his way despite being unable to walk straight. “I must – today – must go – “

tr: "Hayır, hayır!" Boğuldu ve kusacak gibi oldu. Düzgün yürüyememesine rağmen devam etmeye çalıştı. "Bugün - gitmek - zorundayım.

es_translation: —No, no! —He felt tremendous retches but continued on his way, although staggering—. I have to... precisely today... I have to...

en: They stepped out of the alleyway together. Fifty yards along the crowded pavement there were spiked black railings flanking two flights of stairs, one labeled GENTLEMEN, the other LADIES.
vi: Tụi nó cùng nhau đi ra khỏi con hẻm. Dọc theo năm mươi thước của lề đường đông đúc là một hàng rào chắn bằng sắt đen có đầu nhọn chắn giữa hai dãy cầu thang, một đeo bảng QUÝ ÔNG, một đeo bảng QUÝ BÀ.
tr: Geçit yolundan beraber çıktılar. Elli metre uzunluğundaki kaldırımın sivri uçlu metal parmaklıklarının birinde BAYANLAR, diğerinde de BAYLAR yazıyordu.
es: Salieron del callejón. En la abarrotada acera de la calle principal, a unos cincuenta metros, unas rejas negras y puntiagudas flanqueaban dos tramos de escalones, uno con el letrero «Damas» y el otro «Caballeros».
vi_translation: They walked together out of the alley. Along the fifty meters of the bustling sidewalk was a black iron fence with pointed tops, standing between two sets of stairs, one labeled GENTLEMEN, the other labeled LADIES.
tr_translation: They exited the passageway together. On one of the pointed metal railings of the fifty-meter-long sidewalk, it said LADIES, and on the other, it said GENTLEMEN.
es_translation: They exited the alley. On the crowded sidewalk of the main street, about fifty meters away, black pointed railings flanked two sets of steps, one with the sign "Ladies" and the other "Gentlemen".

en: The silver stag soared from the tip of Harry’s wand and leaped toward the dementors, which fell back and melted into the dark shadows again. The stag’s light, more powerful and more warming than the cat’s protection, filled the whole dungeon as it cantered around the room.
vi: Con hươu bạc phóng ra từ đầu cây đũa phép của Harry và nhảy về phía bọn Giám ngục khiến bọn chúng rút lui và lại tan vào bóng tối. Ánh sáng của con hươu mạnh và ấm hơn sức bảo vệ của con mèo, tràn khắp căn hầm khi nó phi quanh phòng.
tr: Gümüş geyik Harry‘nin asasından fırladı ve Ruh Emiciler'i savuşturdu. Patronus geyiğin etkisi kedininkinden çok daha fazlaydı.
es: El ciervo plateado surgió de la varita de Harry y se abalanzó sobre los dementores, que retrocedieron rápidamente hacia la oscuridad. El ciervo trotaba de una punta a otra de la mazmorra y su luz, más poderosa y más cálida que la del gato, iluminó la estancia por completo.
vi_translation: The silver stag shot out from the tip of Harry's wand and leaped towards the Dementors, causing them to retreat and dissolve back into the darkness. The light from the stag was stronger and warmer than the protection of the cat, flooding the dungeon as it galloped around the room.
tr_translation: The silver stag shot out from Harry's wand and warded off the Dementors. The effect of the Patronus stag was far greater than that of the cat's.
es_translation: The silver stag emerged from Harry's wand and charged at the dementors, who quickly retreated into the darkness. The stag trotted from one end of the dungeon to the other, and its light, more powerful and warmer than that of the cat, illuminated the entire room.

en: It was as large as a chicken’s egg. An ornate letter S, inlaid with many small green stones, glinted dully in the diffused light shining through the tent’s canvas roof.
vi: Nó bự bằng cái trứng gà. Một chữ S cầu kỳ khắc chìm cùng với nhiều viên đá nhỏ màu xanh biếc, lấp lánh yếu ớt trong ánh sáng khuếch tán chiếu xuyên qua nóc vải bạt của cái lều.
tr: Bir tavuk yumurtası büyüklüğündeydi. Gösterişli bir S harfi, bir çok küçük yeşil taşla işlenmişti, çadırın tepesinden yayılarak gelen ışıktan dolayı donuk bir şekilde parıldıyordu.
es: Era más o menos del tamaño de un huevo de gallina. Una ornamentada «S», con piedrecitas verdes incrustadas, brillaba un poco bajo la difuminada luz que se filtraba por la lona de la tienda.
vi_translation: It is as big as a chicken egg. An elaborate S-shaped engraving along with many small blue stones, faintly sparkling in the diffused light shining through the canvas roof of the tent.
tr_translation: It was the size of a chicken egg. A fancy letter S, encrusted with many small green stones, was shimmering dully due to the light spreading from the top of the tent.
es_translation: It was roughly the size of a chicken egg. An ornate "S", with embedded green stones, glimmered slightly under the diffused light filtering through the tent's canvas.

en: He sat low in one of Perkins's old armchairs, feeling more humiliated by the moment. He was afraid that something had gone wrong inside him. Yesterday seemed a long time ago: Today me might have been thirteen years old again, the only one who collapsed on the Hogwarts Express.
vi: Nó ngồi thụp xuống một trong mấy cái ghế bành cũ của ông Perkins, giờ đây lại càng cảm thấy nhục nhã hơn. Nó sợ là có cái gì đó bị trục trặc trong người nó. Ngày hôm qua dường như cách đây đã lâu lắm rồi: hôm nay có lẽ nó đã trở lại tuổi mười ba một lần nữa, trở thành đứa trẻ duy nhất gục ngã trên chuyến xe lửa tốc hành Hogwarts.
tr: Perkins'in eski sandalyelerinden birine çöktü, kendini daha da utanmış hissederek. içinde bir şeylerin yanlış gittiğinden korkuyordu. Dün, çok uzun zaman önceymiş gibiydi. Bugün Hogwarts Ekspresi'nde, cesaretini yitirmiş ve yeniden on üç yaşında olabilirdi.
es: Se dejó caer en una de las viejas butacas de Perkins; cada vez se sentía más humillado y temía que algún meca-nismo interior hubiera dejado de funcionarle. El día anterior parecía muy lejano; se sentía como si volviera a tener trece años y fuera el único que se desplomaba en el expreso de Hogwarts.
vi_translation: It slumped down into one of Mr. Perkins' old armchairs, now feeling even more humiliated. It was afraid that something was wrong with it. Yesterday seemed like it was a long time ago: today it felt like it had turned thirteen again, becoming the only child to collapse on the Hogwarts Express.
tr_translation: He collapsed into one of Perkins' old chairs, feeling even more ashamed. He was afraid that something was going wrong inside him. Yesterday felt like it was a long time ago. Today on the Hogwarts Express, he could have lost his courage and been thirteen years old again.
es_translation: He let himself fall into one of Perkins' old armchairs; he felt increasingly humiliated and feared that some internal mechanism had stopped working. The previous day seemed very distant; he felt as if he were thirteen again and the only one collapsing on the Hogwarts Express.

en: A fire danced into life on the other side of the canvas, large shadows passed between tent and flames. The delicious smell of baking salmon wafted tantalizingly in their direction. Then came the clinking of cutlery on plates, and the first man spoke again.
vi: Một đốm lửa bừng sáng lên bên kia vách lều, những cái bóng to thù lù qua lại giữa ngọn lửa và căn lều. Mùi cá hồi nướng thơm phưng phức bay về phía tụi nó đầy khiêu khích. Kế đến là tiếng lanh canh của dao nĩa chạm vào chén dĩa, và người đầu tiên lại nói.
tr: Çadır bezinin diğer tarafında alevler dans etmeye başladı; kocaman gölgeler çadır ve alevler arasından geçti. Somon balığının pişerkenki lezzetli kokusu onlara doğru geldi. Sonra tabağın üstündeki çatal bıçak sesleri geldi ve ilk adam yeniden konuştu.
es: Un fuego prendió en el exterior, y los chicos vieron pasar unas sombras enormes entre la tienda y las llamas, al mismo tiempo que les llegaba el delicioso y tentador aroma a salmón asado. A continuación se oyó el tintineo de cubiertos sobre platos, y el desconocido que había hablado primero volvió a hacerlo:

The enticing aroma of grilled salmon wafted towards them. Next came the clinking sounds of knives and forks hitting plates, and the first person spoke again.

es_translation: A fire started outside, and the boys saw huge shadows passing between the tent and the flames, at the same time as the delicious and tempting aroma of roasted salmon reached them. Next, the clinking of cutlery on plates was heard, and the stranger who had spoken first spoke again:

en: “You had a false impression,” said the higher-voiced of the goblins. “We take no sides. This is a wizards’ war.”
vi: “Ông có ấn tượng sai lầm rồi,” con yêu tinh có giọng cao nói. “Chúng tôi không theo phe nào cả. Đây là chiến tranh phù thủy.”
tr: "Yanlış izlenim edinmişsin," dedi en yüksek sesli cincüce. "Biz taraf tutmayız. Bu büyücülerin savaşı.
es: Creía que los duendes apoyaban a Quien-vosotros-sabéis. —Pues estabas equivocado, porque nosotros no nos ponemos de parte de nadie —dijo el duende de voz más aguda—. Esta es una guerra de magos.
vi_translation: "You have the wrong impression," the goblin said in a high-pitched voice. "We do not take sides. This is a wizard's war."
tr_translation: "You have gotten the wrong impression," said the loudest dwarf. "We do not take sides. This is the wizards' war."
es_translation: I thought goblins supported You-Know-Who. —Well, you were wrong, because we don't take sides —said the elf with the sharpest voice—. This is a war of wizards.

en: “Duties ill-befitting the dignity of my race,” replied the goblin, his voice rougher and less human as he said it. “I am not a house-elf.”
vi: “Những nhiệm vụ không-thích-hợp với đạo đức chủng tộc tôi,” con yêu tinh trả lời, khi nói vậy giọng y khô khốc hơn và ít tính người hơn. “Tôi không phải là một gia tinh.
tr: "Asil soyumun uygunsuz görevleri," diye yanıtladı cincüce, bunu söylerken sesi daha az insancıl ve kabaydı. "Ben evcini değilim.
es: —Cosas inapropiadas para la dignidad de mi raza —contestó el duende con tono más tosco y menos humano—. Yo no soy ningún elfo doméstico.
vi_translation: “Tasks that are inappropriate to the ethics of my race,” the goblin replied, his voice becoming drier and less human as he spoke. “I am not a house-elf.”
tr_translation: "The improper tasks of my noble lineage," replied the gnome, his voice less human and rougher as he spoke. "I am not a house-elf.""
es_translation: —Inappropriate things for the dignity of my race —replied the goblin in a rougher and less human tone—. I am not a house-elf.

en: “remove this foul addition at once! Remove it, I say! You are ruining a great work of art! Where am I? What is going on?”

tr: "Derhal şu çirkin şeyi kaldırın! Kaldırın, size söylüyorum! Mükemmel bir sanat eserini mahvediyorsunuz! Neredeyim? Neler oluyor?
