vi_translation: “Take off this stinky embellishment right now! I said, take it off! You are ruining a great work of art! Where am I? What is happening?”
tr_translation: "Remove that ugly thing immediately! Remove it, I'm telling you! You are ruining a perfect piece of art! Where am I? What is happening?"
es_translation: —Remove this filthy addition from me immediately! I said remove it! You're ruining a great work of art! Where am I? What's going on here?

en: “Yeah, and we’re about as near getting rid of it as we are to finding the rest of them—nowhere effing near in other words.”
vi: “Đúng, và tụi mình tìm cách diệt nó cũng khốn khổ không kém gì tìm kiếm những cái còn lại - nói cách khác, không có kẽ thoát
tr: "Ve gerisini bulmak üzereyken neredeyse bundan bıkmak üzereyiz, lanet olası yakınımızda hiç bir yerde değil-”
es: —Sí, y estamos tan cerca de deshacernos de él como de encontrar los otros. ¡O sea, a años luz!
vi_translation: “Yes, and finding a way to destroy it was just as miserable as searching for the remaining ones - in other words, there's no escape!”
tr_translation: "And just when we're about to find the rest, we're almost sick of it, it's nowhere damn near us-”
es_translation: —Yes, and we are as close to getting rid of him as we are to finding the others. In other words, light years away!

en: “Erm,” he said, smiling for what felt like the first time in months: The muscles in his face felt oddly stiff. “I might’ve opened it, you know, when I bought it . . . just the once. . . .”
vi: “Ờ…” Harry nói, mỉm một nụ cười mà nó có cảm giác như nụ cười đầu tiên trong suốt mấy tháng qua: các cơ trên mặt nó cứng ngơ cứng ngắc một cách kỳ cục. “Có lẽ mình có mở ra, bồ biết, khi mình mua cuốn sách… chỉ một lần…”
tr: "Şey," dedi Harry aylardır ilk defa gülümsediğini fark ederek. Yüzündeki kasların tuhaf bir şekilde kasılıp kaldığını hissetti. "Açmışımdır herhalde, bilirsin, aldığım zaman... Sadece bir kereliğine...
es: —Pues... —sonrió Harry, y tuvo la impresión de que hacía meses que no lo hacía, porque notó una extraña rigi-dez en los músculos de la cara—. Bueno, creo que lo abrí alguna vez cuando lo compré.
vi_translation: “Uh…” Harry said, smiling a smile that felt like the first one in months: the muscles on his face were stiff in a peculiar way. “Maybe I did open it, you know, when I bought the book… just once…”
tr_translation: "Well," said Harry, realizing he was smiling for the first time in months. He felt the muscles in his face stiffen in a strange way. "I must have opened it, you know, when I got it... Just for once..."
es_translation: —Well... —Harry smiled, and he had the impression that he hadn't done so in months, because he noticed a strange stiffness in the muscles of his face—. Well, I think I opened it once when I bought it.

en: “What?” he said, half angry, half relieved. “What did you do that for? I thought you’d seen a Death Eater unzipping the tent, at least –“
vi: “Cái gì hả?” Nó nói, nửa nổi giận nửa thở phào. “Bồ làm như vậy để chi? Mình tưởng bồ vừa thấy một tên Tử Thần Thực Tử rạch lều ra, ít nhất thì…”
tr: "Ne?" dedi Harry, yarı kızgın, yarı rahatlamış bir şekilde. "Neden böyle bir şey yaptın? Bir Ölüm Yiyen‘in çadırın fermuarını indirirken gördüğünü sandım, en azından-"
es: —¿Qué pasa? —preguntó, entre enfadado y aliviado—. ¿Por qué has hecho eso? Creía que habías visto a un mortí- fago colándose en la tienda, como mínimo.
vi_translation: “What?” he said, half angry, half relieved. “Why did you do that? I thought you had just seen a Death Eater slashing the tent open, at least…”
tr_translation: "What?" said Harry, half angry, half relieved. "Why did you do such a thing? I thought I saw a Death Eater unzipping the tent, at least-"
es_translation: —What's going on? —he asked, both angry and relieved—. Why have you done that? I thought you had seen a morti- fago sneaking into the store, at the very least.

en: Strung all around with colored lights, there was what looked like a war memorial in the middle, partly obscured by a windblown Christmas tree. There were several shops, a post office, a pub, and a little church whose stained-glass windows were glowing jewel-bright across the square.
vi: Có cái gì đó trông giống như một tượng đài kỷ niệm chiến tranh đứng ngay chính giữa, chung quanh treo lủng lẳng đầy đèn màu, bị che khuất phần nào vì một cây Giáng sinh bị gió thổi bạt. Bên kia quảng trường có nhiều cửa tiệm, một bưu điện, một quán rượu, và một ngôi nhà thờ nhỏ có cửa sổ bằng kiếng màu sáng rực rỡ lóng lánh.
tr: Meydanın her tarafında renkli ışıkların süzüldüğü, şiddetli rüzgârlardan dolayı hafif yan yatmış Noel ağacından dolayı bir kısmı anca görünen savaş anıtına benzeyen bir şey vardı. Meydanda birkaç dükkân, bir postane, bir bar ve meydana mücevher parlaklığında ışık yayan vitray camları olan küçük bir kilise vardı.
es: En medio de la plaza, rodeado de luces de colores ensartadas y parcialmente tapado por un árbol de Navidad sacudido por el viento, se erigía un monumento a los caídos en la guerra. Había varias tiendas, una oficina de correos, un pub y una pequeña iglesia, cuyas vidrieras de colores relucían al otro lado de la plaza.
vi_translation: There was something that looked like a war memorial standing right in the middle, surrounded by hanging colorful lights, partially obscured by a wind-blown Christmas tree. Across the square, there were many shops, a post office, a pub, and a small church with brightly shining stained glass windows.
tr_translation: There was something resembling a war monument, partially visible due to the Christmas tree, which was slightly tilted because of the strong winds, with colorful lights streaming all around the square. In the square, there were a few shops, a post office, a bar, and a small church with stained glass windows emitting jewel-like brightness.
es_translation: In the middle of the square, surrounded by strings of colorful lights and partially obscured by a Christmas tree shaken by the wind, stood a monument to those who fell in the war. There were several shops, a post office, a pub, and a small church, whose stained glass windows gleamed on the other side of the square.

en: They waded deeper and deeper into the graveyard, gouging dark tracks into the snow behind them, stooping to peer at the words on old headstones, every now and then squinting into the surrounding darkness to make absolutely sure that they were unaccompanied.
vi: Tụi nó lội càng lúc càng sâu hơn vô nghĩa trang, vẹt thành những rãnh tối trong tuyết phía sau lưng, lom khom để săm soi những hàng chữ trên dãy bia mộ cũ kỹ, thỉnh thoảng liếc mắt vào bóng tối chung quanh để biết chắc chắn không có ai khác ngoài tụi nó.
tr: Arkalarında karda derin izler oluşturarak, eski mezar taşlarında yazan kelimeleri okuyabilmek için durarak, arada bir yalnız olduklarından kesin olarak emin olmak için kısık gözlerle etraflarındaki karanlığa bakarak mezarlıkta güç bela gittikçe daha da derine gittiler.
es: Se adentraron en el cementerio y continuaron dejando un oscuro rastro en la nieve; iban agachándose para leer las inscripciones de las viejas lápidas, y de vez en cuando escudriñaban la oscuridad circundante para asegurarse de que estaban solos.
vi_translation: They waded deeper and deeper into the cemetery, carving dark furrows in the snow behind them, hunched over to scrutinize the inscriptions on the rows of old tombstones, occasionally glancing into the surrounding darkness to make sure there was no one else but them.
tr_translation: Leaving deep tracks in the snow behind them, stopping to read the words written on the old tombstones, occasionally glancing into the darkness around them with squinted eyes to be absolutely sure they were alone, they struggled to go deeper and deeper into the cemetery.
es_translation: They ventured into the cemetery and continued leaving a dark trail in the snow; they bent down to read the inscriptions on the old tombstones, and occasionally peered into the surrounding darkness to make sure they were alone.

en: It did not stir. He had not expected it to. If it had been that easy the sword would have lain on the ground for him to pick up, not in the depths of a frozen pool. He set off around the circle of ice, thinking hard about the last time the sword had delivered itself to him. He had been in terrible danger then, and had asked for help.
vi: Thanh gươm không nhúc nhích. Nó cũng không trông mong điều đó lắm. Nếu dễ ợt như vậy thì thanh gươm cứ việc nằm trên mặt đất cho nó lượm lên, chứ nằm chi dưới đáy hồ đóng băng. Nó bắt đầu đi vòng quanh hồ băng, nghiền ngẫm về cái lần trước đây thanh gươm tự nguyện đặt vào tay nó. Lúc đó nó lâm vào tình huống nguy kịch, và nó đã cầu cứu.
tr: Hareket etmedi. Beklememişti de. Eğer o kadar kolay olsaydı, kılıç alması için yere konulmuş olurdu, donmuş bir havuzun derinlikleride değil. Buz çemberinin etrafında dolandı, kılıcın kendini ona son yollayışını düşünüyordu. O zaman korkunç bir tehlike içindeydi ve yardım istemişti.
es: Pero la espada no se movió, aunque Harry tampoco confiaba en que lo hiciera. Si hubieran querido que fuera así de fácil, no la habría encontrado bajo el agua, sino en el suelo, y la habría cogido sin más. Se puso a andar alrededor del círculo de hielo, tratando de recordar cada detalle de la última vez que la espada se le había entregado. Entonces él estaba amenazado por un gran peligro, y había pedido ayuda.
vi_translation: The sword did not budge. It did not expect it to, either. If it were that easy, the sword would just lie on the ground for it to pick up, rather than lying at the bottom of a frozen lake. It began to walk around the frozen lake, pondering about the last time the sword willingly placed itself in its hand. At that time, it was in a dire situation, and it had called for help.
tr_translation: He did not move. Nor had he waited. If it were that easy, the sword would have been placed on the ground for him to take, not in the depths of a frozen pool. He circled around the ice ring, thinking about the last time the sword had sent itself to him. At that time, he was in terrible danger and had called for help.
es_translation: But the sword did not move, although Harry did not trust it to do so either. If they had wanted it to be that easy, he would not have found it underwater, but on the ground, and he would have simply picked it up. He began to walk around the circle of ice, trying to remember every detail of the last time the sword had been given to him. Then he was threatened by great danger, and he had asked for help.

en: Contemplating the task ahead would not make it easier or the water warmer. He stepped to the pool's edge and placed Hermione's wand on the ground still lit. Then, trying not to imagine how much colder he was about to become or how violently he would soon be shivering, he jumped.
vi: Toan tính công việc trước cũng chẳng làm cho công việc dễ hơn hay nước ấm hơn. Nó bước tới mép hồ và đặt cây đũa phép vẫn còn thắp sáng trên mặt đất. Sau đó, cố gắng không hình dung xem mình sắp bị lạnh hơn bao nhiêu hay sẽ rùng mình dữ dội đến cỡ nào, nó nhảy ùm xuống.
tr: Önündeki görevi uzun uzun düşünmek işi kolaylaştırmayacaktı, ya da suyu ısıtmayacaktı. Havuzun kenarına doğru adım attı ve Hermione‘nin asasını yere koydu, hala ucu yanıyordu. Sonra, biraz sonra, ne kadar daha üşüyeceğini ya da yakında ne kadar şiddetle titreyeceğini gözünde canlandırmamaya çalışarak, atladı.
es: Pero pensar en la tarea que tenía por delante no la haría más fácil, ni el agua se calentaría, de modo que se acercó al borde de la charca y dejó en el suelo la varita de Hermione, todavía encendida. Entonces, intentando no imaginar que iba a sentir un frío mortal ni lo que llegaría a tiritar, se metió en el agua hasta los hombros.
vi_translation: Calculating the work beforehand neither makes the work easier nor the water warmer. It stepped to the edge of the lake and placed the still-lit wand on the ground. Then, trying not to imagine how much colder it would get or how violently it would shiver, it jumped in with a splash.
tr_translation: Thinking long and hard about the task ahead wouldn't make it any easier, nor would it heat the water. He stepped towards the edge of the pool and placed Hermione's wand on the ground, its tip still glowing. Then, a moment later, trying not to imagine how much colder he would get or how violently he would soon be shivering, he jumped.
es_translation: But thinking about the task ahead wouldn't make it any easier, nor would the water get any warmer, so he approached the edge of the pond and placed Hermione's still-lit wand on the ground. Then, trying not to imagine the deadly cold he was about to feel or how much he would shiver, he got into the water up to his shoulders.

en: The cold was agony: It attacked him like fire. His brain itself seemed to have frozen as he pushed through the dark water to the bottom and reached out, groping for the sword. His fingers closed around the hilt; he pulled it upward.
vi: Cái lạnh cực kỳ tàn khốc: cơn lạnh hành nó không khác gì lửa. Chính cái đầu dường như đã đóng băng ngay khi nó thụp đầu xuống làn nước tối thui, nhắm hướng đáy hồ và vói tay ra, dò tìm thanh gươm. Ngón tay nó siết quanh chuôi gươm; nó rút thanh gươm lên.
tr: Soğuk büyük ıstıraptı: Ona ateş gibi saldırdı. Karanlık su boyunca kendini itip uzanıp kılıcı almak için elini uzatırken beyni de donmuş gibiydi. Parmakları kabzanın etrafında kapandı; yukarı doğru çekti.
es: El frío le propinó un latigazo de dolor lacerante como fuego, y al sumergirse tuvo la impresión de que el cerebro se le congelaba. Buscó a tientas la espada y, por fin, la asió por la empuñadura y tiró de ella.
vi_translation: The cold was extremely brutal: the chill tormented him as if it were fire. His head seemed to freeze the moment he ducked into the pitch-black water, aiming for the bottom of the lake and reaching out, searching for the sword. His fingers closed around the hilt of the sword; he pulled the sword up.
tr_translation: The cold was a great torment: It attacked him like fire. As he pushed himself along the dark water and reached out to grab the sword, his brain felt frozen. His fingers closed around the hilt; he pulled it upward.
es_translation: The cold dealt him a lashing pain like fire, and as he submerged, he had the impression that his brain was freezing. He groped for the sword and, finally, grasped it by the hilt and pulled it out.

en: Choking and retching, soaking and colder than he had ever been in his life, he came to facedown in the snow. Somewhere, close by, another person was panting and coughing and staggering around, as she had come when the snake attacked....Yet it did not sound like her, not with those deep coughs, no judging by the weight of the footsteps....
vi: Nghẹt thở và ói ộc, ướt nhem và lạnh chưa từng thấy, nó tỉnh lại, mặt úp xuống tuyết. Đâu đó, sát một bên, một người khác đang thở hổn hển, ho sặc sụa và loạng choạng vòng quanh. Hermione đã lại đến, như đã đến khi con mãng xà tấn công… nhưng nghe không có vẻ gì giống Hermione cả, không phải Hermione với những tiếng ho khùng khục đó, càng không phải nếu xét theo tiếng bước chân nặng nề…
tr: Nefesi kesilerek ve böğürerek, sırılsıklam ve hayatında hiç üşümediği kadar üşüyerek, karda yüzükoyun yattı. Yakında biri, başka bir insan hızla nefes alıyordu ve öksürüyordu ve sendeliyordu. Hermione tekrar gelmişti, yılan saldırdığında geldiği gibi... Ama onun sesine benzemiyordu, bu derin öksürükler, ayakların ağırlıkları ona benzemiyordu...
es: Cuando recobró el conocimiento se hallaba boca abajo sobre la nieve, tosiendo y con arcadas, empapado y helado como nunca; cerca de él había alguien que también jadeaba, tosía y se tambaleaba. Supuso que Hermione lo había salvado una vez más, como cuando lo había atacado la serpiente. No obstante, esas toses estentóreas y esos pasos rui-dosos no parecían los de su amiga...
vi_translation: Choking and vomiting, soaking wet and colder than ever before, it woke up, face down in the snow. Somewhere nearby, someone else was gasping for breath, coughing violently, and staggering around. Hermione had come again, as she had when the serpent attacked… but it didn't sound like Hermione at all, not Hermione with those harsh coughs, and certainly not if you considered the heavy footsteps…
tr_translation: Breathless and moaning, soaking wet and colder than he had ever been in his life, he lay face down in the snow. Nearby, someone else, another person, was breathing rapidly, coughing, and stumbling. Hermione had come again, just as she had when the snake attacked... But it didn't sound like her, these deep coughs, the weight of the footsteps didn't resemble hers...
es_translation: When he regained consciousness, he found himself face down on the snow, coughing and retching, soaked and colder than ever; near him was someone else who was also gasping, coughing, and staggering. He assumed that Hermione had saved him once again, like when the snake had attacked him. However, those loud coughs and noisy footsteps did not seem to belong to his friend...

en: “I did think I saw something move over there, but I was running to the pool at the time, because you'd gone in and you hadn't come up, so I wasn't going to make a detour to -- hey!”
vi: “Mình nghĩ là mình có thấy cái gì đó di chuyển ở đằng kia, nhưng lúc đó mình đang chạy tới cái hồ, bởi vì bồ đã nhảy xuống đó mà không thấy bồ trồi lên, thành ra mình không quay trở lại để… Ê!”
tr: "Orada bir şeyin hareket ettiğini gördüğümü sandım, ama o anda havuza doğru koşuyordum, çünkü içeri girmiştin ve dışarı çıkmamıştın, o yüzden yönümü değiştirmeyi - hey!
es: Mira, me pareció ver que algo se movía por ahí, pero fue cuando iba a toda pastilla hacia la charca, porque te habías metido en el agua y no salías, y no iba a dar un rodeo para... Eh, ¿adonde vas?
vi_translation: “I think I saw something moving over there, but at that moment I was running towards the lake because you had jumped in and didn't come up, so I didn't turn back to... Hey!”
tr_translation: "I thought I saw something moving there, but at that moment I was running towards the pool because you had gone in and hadn't come out, so I was about to change my direction - hey!"
es_translation: Look, I thought I saw something moving over there, but it was when I was rushing towards the pond because you had gone into the water and weren't coming out, and I wasn't going to take a detour to...

en: “Least loved, always, by the mother who craved a daughter . . . Least loved, now, by the girl who prefers your friend . . . Second best, always, eternally overshadowed . . .”
vi: “Luôn luôn là kẻ ít được má cưng nhất, vì bà ước mong một đứa con gái… bây giờ lại ít được cô bạn gái yêu nhất, vì cô ta chọn thằng bạn của mày… Luôn luôn là đồ hạng hai, mãi mãi bị án bóng…”
tr: "Her zaman en az sevilen, bir kız arzulayan anne tarafından... En az sevilen olmak, şimdi, arkadaşını tercih eden kız tarafından... Her zaman ikinci en iyi olmak, sonsuza dek gölgede kalmak...
es: —Siempre has sido el menos querido por una madre que ansiaba tener una hija... Y ahora el menos querido por la chica que prefiere a tu amigo...
vi_translation: “Always the one least favored by mom, because she wished for a daughter… now the least loved by your girlfriend, because she chose your friend… Always second-rate, forever in the shadow…”
tr_translation: "Always the least loved, by a mother who desires a daughter... To be the least loved, now, by a daughter who prefers her friend... Always to be the second best, forever to remain in the shadow..."
es_translation: —You have always been the least loved by a mother who longed to have a daughter... And now the least loved by the girl who prefers your friend...

en: “The little ball of light was hovering there, waiting for me, and when I came out it bobbed along a bit and I followed it behind the shed and then it ... well, it went inside me.”
vi: “Trái cầu ánh sáng nhỏ xíu vẫn còn lượn lờ ở đó chờ mình, mình đi ra thì nó nhấp nhô bay trước một tí, và mình đi theo nó ra đằng sau cái nhà để đồ cũ, thế rồi nó… ừ, nó chui vô trong người mình.”
tr: Küçük ışık topu orada havada durmuş beni bekliyordu ve ben çıktığım anda titrek bir şekilde ilerledi ve ben de onu barakanın arkasına kadar takip ettim ve sonra o... şey, içime girdi.
es: »Y allí estaba la pequeña esfera luminosa suspendida, esperándome. Me acerqué y ella se desplazó un poco, cabeceando; la seguí hasta detrás del cobertizo, y entonces... bueno, entonces se metió dentro de mí.
vi_translation: “The tiny ball of light was still hovering there waiting for me. When I went out, it bobbed a little ahead, and I followed it to the back of the old storage house. Then it... well, it went inside me.”
tr_translation: The small ball of light was there, hovering in the air, waiting for me, and as soon as I stepped out, it moved forward shakily, and I followed it to the back of the shed, and then it... entered me."
es_translation: "And there was the small luminous sphere suspended, waiting for me." I approached, and it moved a little, nodding; I followed it behind the shed, and then... well, then it went inside me.

en: She took a deep breath, as though bracing herself, and said, “It’s that mark, the mark in Beedle the Bard. Look at this!”
vi: Hermione hít sâu một hơi, như thể tự khích lệ mình, rồi nói. “Là cái dấu hiệu đó. Cái dấu hiệu trong cuốn Beedle the Bard. Nhìn cái này coi.”
tr: Hermione kollarını kenetleyerek derin bir nefes aldı ve, "Bu, oradaki işaret, Ozan Beedle‘ın Masalları, işaret, şuna bak. Hermione, Albus Dumbledore‘un Hayatı ve Yalanları‘nı Harry‘nin hiç de hevesli olmayan gözlerine soktu.
es: Hermione inspiró hondo, como si fuera a decir algo muy importante, y respondió: —Es esa marca, la marca que aparece en Beedle el Bardo. ¡Mira esto!
vi_translation: Hermione took a deep breath, as if to encourage herself, then spoke. “It's that symbol. The symbol in The Tales of Beedle the Bard. Look at this.”
tr_translation: Hermione crossed her arms, took a deep breath, and said, "That, the sign over there, The Tales of Beedle the Bard, the sign, look at that." Hermione shoved "The Life and Lies of Albus Dumbledore" into Harry's not-at-all-eager eyes.
es_translation: Hermione took a deep breath, as if she were about to say something very important, and replied: —It's that mark, the mark that appears in Beedle the Bard. Look at this!

en: “Listen, I’ve got a feeling you’d be able to tell who lived there if you looked through the Lovegoods’ window. Let’s try the next lot of hills.”
vi: “Nghe nè, mình có cảm giác là chỉ cần ngó qua cửa sổ nhà Lovegood thôi là đã biết ai ở trong đó rồi. Thử mấy cụm đồi kế đi.”
tr: "Dinleyin, içimde Lovegood'ların nerede yaşadığını pencerelerinden bakarak anlayabileceğimizi söyleyen bir his var. Hadi, diğer tepeyi deneyelim.
es: s
vi_translation: “Listen, I have a feeling that just by looking through the window of the Lovegood house, you can tell who's inside. Try the nearby hills.”
tr_translation: "Listen, I have a feeling that we can figure out where the Lovegoods live by looking through their windows. Come on, let's try the other hill."
es_translation: If you looked out the window of the Lovegood house, you'd know right away who lives there. Let's try the next flowerbed.

en: "'And Death spoke to them. He was angry that he had been cheated out of the three new victims, for travelers usually drowned in the river. But Death was cunning. He pretended to congratulate the three brothers upon their magic, and said that each had earned a prize for having been clever enough to evade him.
vi: “Và Thần Chết nói với họ. Thần rất tức giận là đã bị phỗng tay trên ba nạn nhân mới, bởi vì khách lữ hành thường sẽ chết đuối dưới dòng sông. Nhưng Thần Chết gian xảo lắm. Thần giả bộ chúc mừng ba anh em về pháp thuật của họ, và nói là mỗi người đáng được hưởng một phần thưởng cho sự khôn khéo lách được thần.
tr: "Ve Ölüm onlarla konuştu. Nehirin her zamanki boğulan yolcularının aksine, bu sefer üç yeni kurbanın onu kandırıp boğulmamasına çok kızmıştı. Fakat ölüm daha kurnazdı. Kardeşleri büyülerinden ötürü tebrik ediyormuş gibi davrandı ve onlara onu alt etme zekası gösterdikleri için her birinin bir ödülü hak ettiğini söyledi.
es: —«Y la Muerte les habló. Estaba contrariada porque acababa de perder a tres posibles víctimas, ya que normalmente los viajeros se ahogaban en el río. Pero ella fue muy astuta y, fingiendo felicitar a los tres hermanos por sus poderes mágicos, les dijo que cada uno tenía opción a un premio por haber sido lo bastante listo para eludirla.
vi_translation: “And Death spoke to them. He was very angry that he had been cheated out of three new victims, because travelers usually drowned in the river. But Death was cunning. He pretended to congratulate the three brothers on their magic, and said that each deserved a reward for having been clever enough to evade him.”
tr_translation: "And Death spoke to them. Unlike the river's usual drowning passengers, this time it was very angry that three new victims had tricked it and not drowned. But Death was more cunning. It pretended to congratulate the brothers for their magical feats and told them that each deserved a reward for having the wit to evade it."
es_translation: —"And Death spoke to them. She was upset because she had just lost three potential victims, as travelers usually drowned in the river. But she was very cunning and, pretending to congratulate the three brothers on their magical powers, told them that each had the option of a reward for being clever enough to evade her.

en: "'Then the second brother, who was an arrogant man, decided that he wanted to humiliate Death still further, and asked for the power to recall others from Death. So Death picked up a stone from the riverbank and gave it to the second brother, and told him that the stone would have the power to bring back the dead.
vi: “Kế đến là người anh hai, một kẻ ngạo mạn, quyết định phải làm cho Thần Chết bẽ mặt hơn nữa, nên hỏi xin quyền lực gọi những người khác trở về từ cõi chết. Thần Chết bèn lượm một viên đá bên bờ sông và đưa cho người anh Hai, rồi nói với anh là viên đá đó có quyền năng gọi về những người chết.
tr: "Sonra, kibirli olan ortanca kardeş, Ölüm‘ü daha fazla aşağılamaya karar verdi ve diğerlerini Ölüm‘den döndürmek için güç istedi. Ölüm nehir kenarından bir taş aldı ve onu ortanca kardeşe verdi ve bu taşın ona, ölümü geri getirecek gücü vereceğini söyledi.
es: »A continuación, el hermano mediano, que era muy arrogante, quiso humillar aún más a la Muerte, y pidió que le concediera el poder de devolver la vida a los muertos. La Muerte cogió una piedra de la orilla del río y se la entregó, diciéndole que la piedra tendría el poder de resucitar a los difuntos.
vi_translation: "Next was the second brother, an arrogant man, who decided he must humiliate Death even further, so he asked for the power to summon others back from the dead." "Death then picked up a stone from the riverbank and gave it to the second brother, telling him that the stone had the power to bring back the dead."
tr_translation: "Then, the arrogant middle brother decided to further mock Death and asked for the power to bring others back from Death. Death took a stone from the riverbank and gave it to the middle brother, telling him that this stone would give him the power to bring back the dead."
es_translation: "Next, the middle brother, who was very arrogant, wanted to humiliate Death even more, and asked to be granted the power to bring the dead back to life." Death picked up a stone from the riverbank and handed it to him, telling him that the stone would have the power to resurrect the deceased.

en: "'That very night, another wizard crept upon the oldest brother as he lay, wine-sodden upon his bed. The thief took the wand and for good measure, slit the oldest brother's throat.
vi: “Chính ngay trong đêm đó, một phù thủy khác bò tới chỗ người anh cả khi anh nằm say bét nhè trên giường. Tên trộm ăn cắp cây đũa phép và để đảm bảo an toàn, hắn cắt luôn cổ họng người anh cả.
tr: "O gece, bir büyücü, şaraptan sızmış gibi yatan büyük kardeşin yanı başına gelir. Hırsız asayı değerli olduğunu düşünerek alır ve büyük kardeşin boğazını keser.
es: »Esa misma noche, otro mago se acercó con sigilo mientras el hermano mayor yacía, borracho como una cuba, en su cama, le robó la varita y, por si acaso, le cortó el cuello.
vi_translation: "That very night, another wizard crept up to the eldest brother as he lay there drunk in his bed. The thief stole the wand and, to ensure his safety, slit the eldest brother's throat.
tr_translation: "That night, a wizard comes to the side of the elder brother, who is lying as if passed out from wine. The thief takes the wand, thinking it is valuable, and slits the elder brother's throat."
es_translation: "That very night, another wizard crept up stealthily while the eldest brother lay, drunk as a skunk, in his bed, stole the wand, and, just to be sure, slit his throat."

en: "'Meanwhile, the second brother journeyed to his own home, where he lived alone. Here he took out the stone that had the power to recall the dead, and turned it thrice in his hand. To his amazement and his delight, the figure of the girl he had once hoped to marry, before her untimely death, appeared at once before him.
vi: “Trong lúc đó người anh hai lên đường trở về nhà mình, nơi anh sống một mình. Tại đây anh lấy ra viên đá có quyền phép gọi về người chết và xoay nó ba lần trong tay. Anh ngạc nhiên và vui sướng biết bao khi hiện ra ngay tức thì trước mặt anh hình bóng người con gái anh đã từng hy vọng kết hôn trước khi nàng chết yểu.
tr: "Bu arada, ortanca kardeş, yalnız yaşadığı kendi evine doğru yolculuk etmektedir. Orada ölümü çağırmak için taşı eline alır, taşı üç kez elinde çevirir. Hayret ve sevinçle, bir zamanlar evlenmeyi umduğu, zamansız ölen kızın figürü bir kez daha ona görünür.
es: «Entretanto, el hermano mediano llegó a su casa, donde vivía solo. Una vez allí, cogió la piedra que tenía el poder de revivir a los muertos y la hizo girar tres veces en la mano. Para su asombro y placer, vio aparecer ante él la figura de la muchacha con quien se habría casado si ella no hubiera muerto prematuramente.
vi_translation: “Meanwhile, the older brother set off on his journey back to his home, where he lived alone. There, he took out the stone that had the power to summon the dead and turned it three times in his hand. How amazed and delighted he was when the image of the girl he had once hoped to marry before she died young appeared instantly before him.
tr_translation: "Meanwhile, the middle brother is traveling towards his own house where he lives alone. There, he takes the stone to call upon death, and turns the stone thrice in his hand. With amazement and joy, the figure of the girl he once hoped to marry, who died untimely, appears to him once more."
es_translation: "Meanwhile, the middle brother arrived at his house, where he lived alone. Once there, he took the stone that had the power to revive the dead and spun it three times in his hand. To his amazement and pleasure, he saw the figure of the girl he would have married if she had not died prematurely appear before him.

en: “But that's – I'm sorry, but that's completely ridiculous! How can I possibly prove it doesn't exist? Do you expect me to get hold of – of all the pebbles in the world and test them? I mean, you could claim that anything's real if the only basis for believing in it is that nobody's proved it doesn't exist!”
vi: “Nhưng chuyện đó… Cháu xin lỗi, nhưng chuyện đó hết sức khôi hài! Làm sao cháu có thể chứng minh nó không có thật chứ? Chẳng nhẽ bác muốn cháu đi lượm hết… hết tất cả những viên sỏi trên thế gian mà đem ra thử nghiệm? Ý cháu là, bác có thể tuyên bố bất kỳ cái gì là có thật nếu cơ sở duy nhất để tin vào điều đó chỉ là không ai chứng minh được điều đó không hề có thật sao!”
tr: "Fakat bu- üzgünüm, ama bu tamamen saçmalık! Bunun var olmadığını nasıl kanıtlayabilirim? Dünyadaki tüm çakıl taşlarını alıp test etmemi beklemiyorsunuz ya? Demek istediğim, hiç kimse olmadığını ispatlamadığı sürece herhangi birşeyin gerçek olabileceğini mi düşünüyorsunuz?
es: —¡Pero...! ¡Perdone, pero esto es completamente ridícu-lo! —explotó Hermione, indignada—. ¿Cómo voy a demostrar que no existe? ¿Pretende que examine todos los guijarros del planeta y lo compruebe? Con ese enfoque, usted podría afirmar que cualquier cosa es real basándose únicamente en que nadie ha demostrado lo contrario.
vi_translation: “But that... I'm sorry, but that's absolutely ridiculous! How can I prove that it doesn't exist? Do you want me to pick up... pick up every single pebble in the world to test it? I mean, you could claim anything is real if the only basis for believing it is that no one has proven it doesn't exist!”
tr_translation: "But this- I'm sorry, but this is complete nonsense! How can I prove that it doesn't exist? You don't expect me to take all the pebbles in the world and test them, do you? I mean, do you think anything can be real as long as no one has proven it doesn't exist?"
es_translation: Excuse me, but this is completely ridiculous! —exploded Hermione, indignant—. How am I supposed to prove that it doesn't exist? Do you expect me to examine every pebble on the planet and verify it? With that approach, you could claim that anything is real based solely on the fact that no one has proven otherwise.

en: “Cave Inimicum…Didn’t I say it was an Frumpent horn, didn’t I tell him? And now his house has been blown apart!”
vi: “Chắn địch… mình đã nói với ông ấy cái đó là Sừng nổ, đã nói rồi. Và bây giờ thì nhà ông ấy nổ tanh banh!”
tr: "Cave Inimicum... Onun bir Patlar Boynuz olduğunu söylememiş miydim, ona söylemedim mi? Ve şimdi bütün evi havaya uçtu!
es: —¡Cave inimicum! ¿No decía yo que era un cuerno de erumpent? ¿No se lo dije a Lovegood? ¡Y ahora su casa ha volado en pedazos!
vi_translation: “Blocking the enemy… I already told him that was an Explosive Horn, I already told him. And now his house is blown to smithereens!”
tr_translation: "Cave Inimicum... Didn't I tell him it was a Blasting Horn, didn't I tell him? And now the whole house has blown up!"
es_translation: —Beware the enemy! Didn't I say it was an Erumpent horn? Didn't I tell Lovegood? And now his house has blown to pieces!

en: “But she, the girl in the tale, didn’t really come back, did she? The story says that once people are dead, they belong with the dead. But the second brother still got to see her and talk to her, didn’t he? He even lived with her for a while…”
vi: “Nhưng cô ta, cô gái trong chuyện kể đó, đâu có thực sự sống lại, đúng không? Câu chuyện nói là một khi chết rồi, người ta thuộc về thế giới người chết. Nhưng người anh Hai vẫn còn được gặp cô và nói chuyện với cô, đúng không nào? Người anh hai thậm chí còn sống chung với cô gái một thời gian…
tr: "Ama o kız, hikayedeki, gerçekten geri gelmedi, değil mi? Hikayeye göre insanlar bir kez öldüler mi, ölüler arasına aittirler. Ancak ikinci erkek kardeş onu görüyor ve onunla konuşuyordu, değil mi? Hatta bir süreliğine onunla yaşadı bile...
es: —Pero esa chica, la de la fábula, no resucitó del todo. Según la historia, una vez que alguien muere, pertenece para siempre al mundo de los muertos. Sin embargo, el hermano mediano pudo verla y hablar con ella, ¿verdad? Hasta vivieron juntos cierto tiempo... Harry detectó preocupación y otro sentimiento, no tan fá-
vi_translation: “But she, the girl in that story, didn't really come back to life, did she? The story says that once someone dies, they belong to the world of the dead. But the older brother still got to see her and talk to her, right? The older brother even lived with the girl for a while…”
tr_translation: "But that girl in the story didn't really come back, did she? According to the story, once people die, they belong among the dead. But the second brother saw her and talked to her, didn't he? He even lived with her for a while..."
es_translation: —But that girl, the one from the fable, did not fully come back to life. According to the story, once someone dies, they belong forever to the world of the dead. However, the middle brother was able to see her and talk to her, right? They even lived together for some time... Harry detected worry and another feeling, not so eas-

en: “Three Horcruxes left,” he kept saying. “We need a plan of action, come on! Where haven’t we looked? Let’s go through it again. The orphanage…”
vi: “Còn ba cái Trường Sinh Linh Giá nữa,” nó cứ nói hoài. “Tụi mình cần một kế hoạch hành động, ráng lên! Còn chỗ nào tụi mình chưa tìm nào? Thử rà lại một lượt nữa xem. Viện mồ côi…”
tr: "Üç Hortkuluk kaldı," deyip duruyordu, "Harekete geçmek için bir plana ihtiyacımız var, hadi ama! Nerelere bakmadık? Hadi tekrar edelim. Yetimhane...
es: —Quedan tres Horrocruxes —decía una y otra vez—. ¡Vamos, necesitamos un plan de acción! ¿Dónde no hemos buscado todavía? Volvamos a repasarlo. El orfanato...
vi_translation: “There are still three more Horcruxes,” he kept saying. “We need a plan of action, come on! Where haven't we looked yet? Let's go over it one more time. The orphanage…”
tr_translation: "There are three Horcruxes left," he kept saying, "We need a plan to take action, come on! Where haven't we looked? Let's go over it again. The orphanage..."
es_translation: —There are three Horcruxes left —he kept saying over and over—. Let's go, we need a plan of action! Where haven't we looked yet? Let's go over it again. The orphanage...

en: “…apologize for our temporary absence from the airwaves, which was due to a number of house calls in our area by those charming Death Eaters.”
vi: “…xin lỗi về việc tạm ngưng phát sóng của chúng tôi, sự cố đó là do các Tử Thần Thực Tử duyên dáng đã tiến hành một số vụ xét nhà trong khu vực của chúng tôi.”
tr: dalgadaki geçici yokluğumuz için özür dileriz, bu durum şu sevgi dolu Ölüm Yiyenler'in bulunduğumuz bölgedeki evlere yaptıkları baskından kaynaklanmıştır.
es: «... que nos disculpéis por nuestra ausencia temporal de la radio, debida a las diversas visitas a domicilio que úl- timamente han realizado esos encantadores mortífagos en nuestra zona.»
vi_translation: “…we apologize for the interruption in our broadcast, the incident was due to the charming Death Eaters conducting some house searches in our area.”
tr_translation: "... we apologize for our temporary absence on the wave, this situation is due to the raid on the houses in our area by those loving Death Eaters."
es_translation: "... that you forgive us for our temporary absence from the radio, due to the various home visits that ul- lately those charming Death Eaters have been active in our area.»

en: “Your boyfriend's going to have worse than that done to him if he's on my list,” said the horribly familiar, rasping voice. “Delicious girl... what a treat . . . I do enjoy the softness of the skin. . . .”
vi: “Thằng bồ của mày sẽ còn te tua hơn nữa nếu nó có tên trong danh sách của tao,” giọng nói chát chúa nghe quen một cách hãi hùng, “Gái mỹ miều … sướng phải biết … tao khoái làn da mềm mại…”
tr: "Erkek arkadaşın eğer benim listemdeyse ona yapılan muameleden çok daha fazlasına maruz kalacak," dedi korkunç tanıdık, çatlak bir ses. "Lezzetli bir kız... ne tatlı... cildin yumuşaklığından hoşlanırım...
es: —A tu novio le va a pasar algo mucho peor si está en mi lista —le advirtió aquella voz bronca, horriblemente familiar—. Vaya muchacha tan deliciosa... Qué maravilla... Me encanta la piel tan suave...
vi_translation: "Your boyfriend will be even more battered if his name is on my list," the harsh voice sounded horrifyingly familiar, "Beautiful girl... must feel so good... I love soft skin..."
tr_translation: "If your boyfriend is on my list, he will be subjected to much more than the treatment he has received," said a terrifyingly familiar, cracked voice. "A delicious girl... so sweet... I like the softness of your skin..."
es_translation: —Something much worse is going to happen to your boyfriend if he's on my list —warned that gruff, horribly familiar voice—. What a delightful girl... What a marvel... I love such soft skin...

en: He whipped his hands away in fright. The iron was contorting, twisting itself out of the abstract furls and coils into a frightening face, which spoke in a clanging, echoing voice. “State your purpose!”
vi: Hắn vung mạnh hai tay ra xa. Cánh cổng tự vặn vẹo uốn éo, từ những đường cong chỗ cuốn trừu tượng biến ra một bộ mặt dễ sợ, cái mặt đó nói bằng một giọng leng keng ngân nga: “Nói rõ mục đích!”
tr: Korkuyla ellerini hızlı bir şekilde geri çekti. Demir, sarmallarından ve halkalarından kendisini ayırarak kıvrım kıvrım bükülüp şakırdayarak, yankılanan bir sesle konuşan korkunç bir yüze dönüştü, "Maksadını belirt!"
es: Apartó las manos con rapidez, asustado, pues el hierro empezó a contorsionarse y retorcerse, y sus intrincadas curvas y espirales compusieron un rostro horrendo que habló con una voz resonante y metálica: —¡Manifiesta tus intenciones!
vi_translation: He swung his arms out forcefully. The gate twisted and contorted, from abstract curves transforming into a terrifying face, which spoke in a resonant, jingling voice: "State your purpose!"
tr_translation: He quickly pulled his hands back in fear. The iron, separating itself from its coils and rings, twisted and clattered, turning into a terrifying face that spoke with a resonating voice, "State your purpose!"
es_translation: He quickly withdrew his hands, frightened, as the iron began to contort and twist, and its intricate curves and spirals formed a horrendous face that spoke with a resonant, metallic voice: —Manifest your intentions!

en: She waved her wand, and the werewolf sprang to his feet, but appeared too wary to approach her. He prowled behind an armchair, his filthy curved nails clutching its back.
vi: Bellatrix vẫy cây đũa phép, và gã người sói đứng bật dậy, nhưng có vẻ quá yếu không thể đến gần mụ. Hắn núp sau một cái ghế bành, những móng tay cáu bẩn của hắn bấu chặt tấm lưng.
tr: Kadın asasını salladı ve kurtadam ayakları üzerine dikildi, ama kadına yönelmek için oldukça ihtiyatlı görünüyordu. Bir koltuğun arkasına geçti ve pis, kavisli tırnaklarıyla arkasını kavradı.
es: Bellatrix agitó la varita y el hombre lobo se puso en pie, pero no se atrevió a acercarse a la bruja. Así que se puso a rondar detrás de un sillón, apretando el respaldo con sus curvadas y sucias uñas.
vi_translation: Bellatrix waved her wand, and the werewolf stood up abruptly, but seemed too weak to approach her. He hid behind an armchair, his dirty nails digging into its back.
tr_translation: The woman waved her wand and the werewolf stood on its feet, but it seemed quite cautious to approach the woman. It moved behind a chair and grasped its back with its dirty, curved claws.
es_translation: Bellatrix waved her wand and the werewolf stood up, but he did not dare to approach the witch. So he started prowling behind an armchair, gripping the backrest with his curved and dirty nails.

en: “Oh yes, I expect so. . . . There’s an old nail we use if we need to break anything. . . . Just a moment . . .”
vi: “Ôi được, em hy vọng được… Có một cây đinh cũ mà tụi này xài khi cần cắt đứt bất cứ thứ gì… chờ một chút nghe…”
tr: "Ah evet, sanırım... Bir şeyi kırmak gerektiğinde kullandığımız eski bir çivimiz vardı... Bir saniye...
es: —Sí, claro, supongo que sí... Por aquí hay un clavo viejo que usamos cuando necesitamos romper algo... Esperad un momento...
vi_translation: "Oh, okay, I hope so... There is an old nail that we use when we need to cut through anything... just wait a moment..."
tr_translation: "Ah yes, I think... We had an old nail we used when we needed to break something... One moment..."
es_translation: —Yes, of course, I suppose so... There's an old nail around here that we use when we need to break something... Wait a moment...

en: “What else did you take? What else have you got? Tel me the truth or, I swear, I shall run you through with this knife!”
vi: “Mày đã lấy gì khác nữa? Mày còn lấy gì khác nữa hả? Nói thật cho tao biết, nếu không, tao thề sẽ lóc thịt mày bằng con dao này.”
tr: "Başka ne aldınız? Başka ne var? Bana gerçeği söyle yoksa yemin ederim bu bıçakla seni deşerim!"
es: —¿Qué más os llevasteis de allí? ¿Qué más tenéis? ¡Dime la verdad o te juro que te atravieso con este puñal!
vi_translation: “What else did you take? What else did you take, huh? Tell me the truth, or else, I swear I will carve you up with this knife.”
tr_translation: "What else did you buy? What else is there? Tell me the truth or I swear I'll stab you with this knife!"
es_translation: —What else did you take from there? What else do you have? Tell me the truth or I swear I'll stab you with this dagger!

en: “Kill me, then!” demanded the old man. “You will not win, you cannot win! That wand will never, ever be yours –“
vi: “Cứ giết ta đi!” Lão già yêu cầu. “Mi sẽ thua. Mi không thể thắng! Cây đũa phép đó sẽ không bao giờ, không bao giờ thuộc về mi.”
tr: "Öldür beni o zaman!" dedi yaşlı adam. "Kazanmayacaksın, kazanamayacaksın! O asa asla senin olmayacak!
es: —¡Mátame! —dijo el anciano—. ¡No vencerás! ¡No puedes vencer! ¡Esa varita nunca será tuya, jamás!
vi_translation: "Just kill me!" The old man demanded. "You will lose. You cannot win! That wand will never, never belong to you."
tr_translation: "Then kill me!" said the old man. "You will not win, you cannot win! That wand will never be yours!"
es_translation: —Kill me! —said the old man—. You will not win! You cannot win! That wand will never be yours, never!

en: And then with a little shudder the elf became quite still, and his eyes were nothing more than great glassy orbs, sprinkled with light from the stars they could not see.”
vi: Và rồi sau một cái rùng mình khe khẽ con gia tinh nằm yên, và đôi mắt nó chỉ còn là hai trái cầu thủy tinh to tướng, vô hồn lấp lánh ánh sáng từ những ngôi sao mà đôi mắt nó không còn thấy nữa.
tr: Ve küçük bir titremeyle ev cini hareketsizleşti ve o büyük gözleri birer cam küreden başka bir şey değildi artık.
es: Dobby se estremeció un poco y se quedó inmóvil, y sus ojos se convirtieron en dos enormes y vidriosas esferas salpicadas del resplandor de las estrellas que ya no podían ver.
vi_translation: And then, after a slight shudder, the house-elf lay still, and its eyes were now just two large, lifeless glass orbs, reflecting the light from the stars that it could no longer see.
tr_translation: And with a small tremor, the house-elf became motionless, and those big eyes were nothing more than glass orbs now.
es_translation: Dobby shuddered a little and remained still, and his eyes turned into two enormous and glassy spheres speckled with the glow of the stars they could no longer see.

en: “I’m sorry,” he said without heat, “but it can’t wait. I need to talk to them now. Privately – and separately. It’s urgent.”
vi: “Em xin lỗi chị,” nó nói mà không nóng nảy lắm. “Nhưng không thể chờ được. Em cần nói chuyện với họ ngay bây giờ. Riêng tư… và riêng lẻ. Khẩn cấp lắm”
tr: "Üzgünüm," dedi kızmadan, "ama bekleyemez. Şimdi onlarla konuşmam gerek. Özel bir şekilde - ve ayrı ayrı. Acil.
es: —Perdonadme —repuso Harry con calma—, pero no tenemos tiempo. Necesito hablar con ellos ahora mismo, en privado y por separado. Es muy urgente.
vi_translation: "I'm sorry, sister," he said, not too hastily. "But I can't wait. I need to talk to them right now. Privately... and individually. It's very urgent."
tr_translation: "I'm sorry," he said without anger, "but it can't wait. I need to talk to them now. In a special way - and separately. It's urgent."
es_translation: —Excuse me —replied Harry calmly—, but we don't have time. I need to speak with them right now, privately and separately. It's very urgent.

en: It was like planning to break into the Ministry all over again. They settled to work in the smallest bedroom, which was kept, according to Griphook's preference, in semidarkness.
vi: Như thể lại một phen nữa lên kế hoạch đột nhập Bộ Pháp Thuật. Tụi nó lấy căn phòng nhỏ nhất đó để làm nơi bàn bạc, và theo ý thích của Griphook, căn phòng được giữ trong cảnh tranh tối, tranh sáng.
tr: Bakanlık'a giriş planını baştan sonra tekrar yapmak gibiydi. Çalışmak için, Griphook‘un tercihine göre yarı karanlıkta tutulan en küçük yatak odasına yerleştiler.
es: Fue como planear otra vez la entrada en el ministerio. Se pusieron a trabajar en el mismo dormitorio, quedándose en penumbra porque el duende así lo prefería.
vi_translation: It was as if they were planning another break-in at the Ministry of Magic. They took the smallest room as their meeting place, and at Griphook's request, the room was kept in semi-darkness.
tr_translation: It was like redoing the plan to enter the Ministry from start to finish. To work, they settled in the smallest bedroom, which was kept semi-dark according to Griphook's preference.
es_translation: It was like planning the entry into the ministry all over again. They started working in the same bedroom, staying in the dim light because the goblin preferred it that way.

en: “It's not that, it gets in the way! But I liked my nose a bit shorter, try and do it the way you did last time.”
vi: “Không phải nhưng cũng phải đâu ra đó! Mà mình thích cái mũi của mình ngắn hơn một tí, bồ thử sửa nó như bồ đã làm lần trước ấy.”
tr: "O değil, kalabalık yapıyor! Ama burnum biraz daha kısa olmasını sevdim, dene ve son kez yaptığın gibi yap.
es: —¡No es por eso, es que se me enreda con todo! Lo que me gustó fue esa nariz que me pusiste la última vez, un poco más corta; a ver si te sale igual.
vi_translation: "Not exactly, but it has to be done properly!" "And I would like my nose to be a bit shorter, could you try to fix it like you did last time?"
tr_translation: "Not that one, it makes it crowded!" "But I liked my nose being a bit shorter, try and do it like you did last time.""
es_translation: —It's not because of that, it's that it gets tangled with everything! What I liked was that nose you gave me last time, a bit shorter; let's see if you can make it the same.

en: “It was... it was... the P-Potter b-boy and the t-two accomplices...” “And they took?” he said, his voice rising, a terrible fear gripping him, “Tell me! What did they take?” “A... a s-small golden c-cup m-my Lord...”
vi: “Chúng là… là… th… thằng P… potter và hai đứa đi cùng…” “Và chúng đã lấy đi?” Hắn nói, giọng vút cao, một nỗi sợ khủng khiếp vây chặt lấy hắn. “Nói đi! Chúng đã lấy cái gì?” “Th… thưa Chúa tể… m… một… một cái cúp nhỏ bằng vàng…”
tr: "Onlar... onlar... P-Potter çocuğu ve iki yardakçısı... "Ve ne aldılar?" dedi, sesi yükseliyor, korkunç bir korku sarıyordu benliğini, "Söyle bana! Ne aldılar? "Küçük bir... küçük bir k-kupa L-Lordum...
es: —Eran... eran... Po-Potter... y do-dos... co-cómplices... —¿Y qué se llevaron? —preguntó Voldemort subiendo el tono, atenazado por un espantoso temor—. ¡Habla! ¿Qué se llevaron? —U-una... co-copa... pe-pequeña d-de oro, m-mi señor...
vi_translation: “They are… are… th… that P… Potter and the two who are with him…” “And they took it away?” he said, his voice rising, a terrible fear gripping him. “Tell me! What did they take?” "M… my Lord… a… a small… small gold cup…”
tr_translation: "They... they..." "T-The Potter boy and his two cronies..."" "What did they take from you?" he said, his voice rising, a terrible fear enveloping his being, "Tell me! What did they take?" "A small... a small c-cup L-Lord..."
es_translation: —They were... they were... Po-Potter... and t-two... a-accomplices... —And what did they take? —asked Voldemort, raising his voice, gripped by a dreadful fear—. Speak! What did they take? —A-a... s-small... g-golden cup, m-my lord...

en: Something huge and horned erupted from the wand. Head down, it charged toward the High Street, and out of sight. “That's not what I saw” said the Death Eater, though was less certainly
vi: Một con gì đó rất to và có sừng phóng ra từ cây đũa phép. Đầu chúc xuống, con vật đó chạy lên Phố Cao, rồi mất hút. “Con đó không phải là con tôi thấy,” một tên Tử Thần Thực Tử nói, mặc dù giọng hắn không còn chắc chắn lắm.
tr: Kocaman ve boynuzlu bir şey asanın ucundan fırladı. Aşağı doğru yol alıp High Street‘e doğru hücum etti ve gözden kayboldu. "Bu benim gördüğüm değildi" dedi Ölüm Yiyen, yine de daha az emin görünerek.
es: Una cosa enorme y con cuernos salió de la varita del camarero, agachó la cabeza como si fuera a embestir y enfiló la calle principal hasta perderse de vista. —Ese no es el patronus que he visto —protestó el mortífago, aunque ya no tan convencido.
vi_translation: A very large creature with horns shot out from the wand. With its head lowered, the creature ran up High Street, then disappeared. "That child is not the one I saw," said a Death Eater, although his voice was no longer very certain.
tr_translation: Something big and horned shot out from the tip of the wand. It descended rapidly, charged towards High Street, and disappeared from sight. "This was not what I saw," said the Death Eater, though looking less certain.
es_translation: A huge thing with horns came out of the waiter’s wand, lowered its head as if to charge, and headed down the main street until it was out of sight. —That's not the Patronus I've seen —protested the Death Eater, though not as convinced anymore.

en: "It destroyed her, what they did: She was never right again. She wouldn't use magic, but she couldn't get rid of it; it turned inward and drove her mad, it exploded out of her when she couldn't control it, and at times she was strange and dangerous. But mostly she was sweet and scared and harmless.
vi: “Việc đó đã hủy hoại con nhỏ: nó không bao giờ hoàn toàn bình phục lại được. Nó không dùng được pháp thuật nữa nhưng lại không thoát khỏi được pháp thuật; năng lực pháp thuật chuyển vào bên trong khiến nó phát khùng, khi nó không kiềm chế được thì năng lực pháp thuật bùng phát ra ngoài, những lúc đó nó thành kỳ quái và nguy hiểm. Còn thường thì con nhỏ dễ thương và nhút nhát vô hại.”
tr: "Bu onu mahvetti, yaptıkları şey: Bir daha hiç düzelmedi. Sihir kullanmadı, ancak ondan tam da kurtulamadı, yolundan çıktı ve onu çıldırttı, kontrol edemediği zamanlarda onu patlattı ve bazı zamanlar oldukça garip ve tehlikeli oluyordu. Ancak çoğu zaman tatlı, korkmuş ve zararsızdı.
es: —Lo que le hicieron esos chicos la dejó destrozada y nunca volvió a ser la misma. Ariana no quería emplear la magia, pero tampoco podía librarse de ella, y la magia se le quedó dentro y la enloqueció; explotaba cuando ella no conseguía controlarla, y a veces hacía cosas extrañas y peligrosas. Pero en general era una niña cariñosa e inofensiva, y estaba muy asustada.
vi_translation: “That incident ruined the child: she never fully recovered. She could no longer use magic, but she couldn't escape from it either; the magical energy turned inward, driving her mad. When she couldn't control it, the magic would burst out, making her strange and dangerous. But most of the time, she was a sweet and shy harmless girl.”
tr_translation: "It destroyed him, what they did: He never recovered. He didn't use magic, but he never fully got rid of it, it went out of his control and drove him crazy, it exploded when he couldn't control it, and sometimes it was quite strange and dangerous. But most of the time he was sweet, scared, and harmless.
es_translation: —What those boys did to her left her shattered, and she was never the same again. Ariana didn't want to use magic, but she couldn't get rid of it either, and the magic stayed inside her and drove her crazy; it would explode when she couldn't control it, and sometimes it did strange and dangerous things. But generally, she was a loving and harmless child, and she was very scared.

tr: "- sanırım yardım etmeye çalıştı, ama tam olarak ne yaptığını bilmiyordu, ve bunu hangimiz yaptık bilmiyorum, herhangi birimiz olabilirdi- o ölmüştü.
es: —Creo que ella sólo quería ayudar, pero en realidad no sabía qué estaba haciendo... Ignoro quién de nosotros fue; pudo ser cualquiera de los tres. Pero el caso es que... Ariana estaba muerta.

en: “Doesn’t matter. They don’t want to spill too much pure blood, so they’ll torture us a bit if we’re mouthy but they won’t actually kill us.”

tr: "Sorun değil. Çok fazla saf kan dökmek istemiyorlar; bu yüzden boşboğazlık yaparsak, bize bir parça işkence uyguluyorlar, fakat gerçekten bizi öldürecekleri yok.
es: —Bueno, no importa. Como no quieren derramar demasiada sangre limpia, sólo nos torturan un poco si somos demasiado respondones, pero no llegan a matarnos.
vi_translation: "It's nothing." "They don't want to spill too much pureblood, so they torment us a bit if we talk back, but they won't really kill us."
tr_translation: "No problem. They don't want to spill too much pure blood; that's why if we blabber, they apply a bit of torture to us, but they really won't kill us."
es_translation: —Well, it doesn't matter. Since they don't want to spill too much clean blood, they only torture us a little if we are too defiant, but they don't go as far as killing us.

en: “We’re up on the fifth floor,” he whispered, watching filch moving away from them, a corridor ahead. “Come on, this way.”

tr: "Beşinci kattayız," diye fısıldadı, Filch'in koridor boyunca onlardan uzaklaşmasını izleyerek. "Hadi, bu taraftan.
es: —Estamos en el quinto piso —susurró mientras veía cómo Füch se alejaba de ellos, un pasillo más allá—. ¡Vamos! ¡Por aquí!

tr_translation: "We are on the fifth floor," he whispered, watching Filch move away from them down the corridor. "Come on, this way.""
es_translation: —We are on the fifth floor —he whispered as he watched Füch walk away from them, down another hallway—. Let's go! This way!

en: “You're acting on Dumbledore's orders?” she repeated with a look of dawning wonder. Then she drew herself up to her fullest height.

tr: "Dumbledore‘un emirleriyle mi hareket ediyorsun?" diye tekrarladı bir mucize seziyormuşçasına. Sonra kendini tam ağırlığına kavuşturdu.
es: —¿Que estás cumpliendo órdenes de Dumbledore? —repitió McGonagall, asombrada.
vi_translation: “Are you following Professor Dumbledore's orders?” She repeated with a surprise tinged with hope. Then she stood up as straight as she could.

en: And as she jogged out of sight, they could hear her muttering, “Tentacula, Devil's Snare. And Snargaluff pods...yes, I'd like to see the Death Eaters fighting those.”
vi: Và trong lúc cô xăng xái chạy đi khuất, mọi người còn nghe lẩm bẩm, “Vòi Bạch tuộc, Bẫy Quỷ sứ, Đậu xà nẹo… ừ ta muốn xem bọn Tử Thần Thực Tử đánh với những thứ đó.”
tr: Ve gözden kaybolunca, onun mırıldanmalarını duyabiliyorlardı. "Tentakula, Şeytan Kapanı. Ve Snargaluf Fasulyesi... evet, Ölüm Yiyenler'in bunlarla savaştığını görmek isterim.
es: Echó a correr y se perdió de vista, pero los demás alcanzaron a oírla murmurar: —Tentacula, lazo del diablo y vainas de snargaluff... Sí, ya me gustará ver cómo combaten eso los mortífagos...
vi_translation: And as she bustled away out of sight, everyone could still hear her muttering, "Devil's Snare, Venomous Tentacula, Snargaluff pods... yes, I'd like to see the Death Eaters fighting those."
tr_translation: And when he disappeared from sight, they could still hear his mutterings. "Tentacula, Devil's Snare. And Snargaluff Pods... yes, I'd like to see the Death Eaters fight those."
es_translation: She started running and disappeared from sight, but the others managed to hear her murmur: —Tentacula, Devil's Snare, and Snargaluff pods... Yes, I'd like to see how the Death Eaters handle that...

en: “Voldemort's on his way, they're barricading he school---Snape's run for it---What are you doing here? How did you know?
vi: “Voldemort đang trên đường đến đây. Mọi người đang dựng chướng ngại vật để bảo vệ trường - lão Snape chạy trốn rồi. Thầy làm gì ở đây? Làm sao thầy biết?”
tr: "Voldemort yolda, okulu müdafaa ediyorlar -Snape tabanları yağladı- Siz ne yapıyorsunuz burada? Nasıl öğrendiniz?
es: —Voldemort está en camino, y aquí están fortificando el colegio. Snape ha huido. Pero... ¿qué hacéis vosotros aquí? ¿Cómo lo habéis sabido?
vi_translation: “Voldemort is on his way here. Everyone is setting up obstacles to protect the school - Snape has fled. What are you doing here? How did you know?”
tr_translation: "Voldemort is on the way, they are defending the school - Snape has fled - What are you doing here? How did you find out?"
es_translation: —Voldemort is on his way, and they are fortifying the school here. Snape has fled. But... what are you doing here? How did you find out?

en: There was a great roar and a surge toward the stairs, he was pressed back against he wall as they ran past hi, the mingled members of the Order of the Phoenix, Dumbledore's Army, and Harry's old Quidditch team, all with their wands drawn, heading up into the main castle.
vi: Một tiếng hô rân trời và mọi người ùn ùn kéo lên cầu thang, Harry bị ép vô sát tường khi những người khác chạy ngang qua nó, thành viên Hội Phượng Hoàng lẫn lộn với Đoàn quân Dumbledore, và đội Quidditch trước đây của Harry, tất cả đều cầm sẵn đũa phép hướng về phía tòa lâu đài chính.
tr: Büyük bir gürültü koptu ve merdivenin ucuna doğru bir dalgalanma, karışmış Zümrüdüanka Yoldaşlığı‘nın üyeleri, Dumbledore‘un Ordusu ve Harry‘nin eski Quidditch takımı, hepsi asaları yukarda, şato yönüne koşup onun yanından geçerken o, arkada duvara doğru sıkıştırılmıştı.
es: Hubo un gran clamor y todo el mundo se precipitó hacia el pie de la escalera. Harry tuvo que pegarse a la pared para dejarlos pasar. Era una mezcla de miembros de la Orden del Fénix, del Ejército de Dumbledore y del antiguo equipo de quidditch de Harry, todos varita en mano, dirigiéndose hacia la parte central del castillo.
vi_translation: A thunderous shout and everyone surged up the stairs, Harry was pressed against the wall as others ran past him, members of the Order of the Phoenix mingling with Dumbledore's Army, and Harry's former Quidditch team, all with wands ready, heading towards the main castle.
tr_translation: A loud noise erupted and a wave of mixed members of the Order of the Phoenix, Dumbledore's Army, and Harry's old Quidditch team, all with their wands raised, ran towards the castle, passing by him as he was pressed against the wall at the back.
es_translation: There was a great clamor and everyone rushed towards the foot of the stairs. Harry had to press himself against the wall to let them pass. It was a mix of members of the Order of the Phoenix, Dumbledore's Army, and Harry's old Quidditch team, all with wands in hand, heading towards the center of the castle.

en: There was a scuffling and a great thump. Someone else had clambered out of the tunnel, overbalanced slightly, and fallen. He pulled himself up no the nearest chair, looked around through lopsided horn-rimmed glasses, and said, “Am I too late? Has it started. I only just found out, so I --- I ---”
vi: Có một tiếng xô mạnh và tiếng ngã uỵch rất to. Một người nào khác đã trèo ra khỏi đường hầm, hơi mất thăng bằng, và ngã lăn quay. Anh ta vịn vào cái ghế quanh đó để đứng lên, nhìn quanh quất qua cặp mắt kiếng gọng sừng lệch một bên, và nói, “Tôi trễ quá rồi à? Bắt đầu rồi à? Tôi chỉ vừa mới biết… cho nên tôi… tôi…”
tr: Kargaşa ve muazzam bir dövüş oldu: Tünelden bir başkası tırmandı, hafif dengesini kaybetti ve düştü. Kendini en yakın sandalyeye sürükledi, yamuk boynuz-kenarlı gözlükleriyle etrafa göz gezdirdi ve, "Çok mu geç kaldım? Başladı mı? Ben sadece daha yeni buldum ve ben- ben-" dedi.
es: En ese momento se oyeron pasos y luego un fuerte golpazo: alguien más acababa de salir por el túnel, pero había perdido el equilibrio y se había caído. El recién llegado se levantó agarrándose a la primera butaca que encontró, miró alrededor a través de unas torcidas gafas de montura de concha y farfulló: —¿Llego tarde? ¿Ha empezado ya? Acabo de enterarme y... y...
vi_translation: There was a loud crash and a very loud thud. Someone else had climbed out of the tunnel, slightly off balance, and fell sprawling. He grabbed a nearby chair to stand up, looked around through his askew horn-rimmed glasses, and said, "Am I too late? Has it started? I just found out... so I... I..."
tr_translation: There was chaos and an immense fight: Another person climbed out of the tunnel, slightly lost their balance, and fell. They dragged themselves to the nearest chair, glanced around with their crooked horn-rimmed glasses, and said, "Am I too late? Has it started? I just found it and I- I-" they said.
es_translation: At that moment, footsteps were heard followed by a loud thud: someone else had just come out of the tunnel, but had lost their balance and fallen. The newcomer stood up by grabbing the first seat they found, looked around through crooked tortoiseshell glasses, and mumbled: —Am I late? Has it already started? I just found out and... and...

en: But her final words were drowned as a different voice echoed throughout the Hall. It was high, cold, and clear. There was no telling from where it came. It seemed to issue from the walls themselves. Like the monster it had once commanded, it might have lain dormant there for centuries.
vi: Nhưng những lời nó cuối câu của cô đã bị nhấn chìm bằng một giọng nói khác vang vọng khắp Đại Sảnh Đường. Giọng đó cao, lạnh, và rõ ràng. Không thể biết được giọng nói đó phát ra từ đâu. Có vẻ như nó phát ra từ chính những bức tường. Như thế nó đã nằm ngủ trong đó nhiều thế kỉ, giống như con quái vật mà nó từng điều khiển.
tr: Ama son kelimeleri salon boyunca başka bir ses yankılanırken boğuldu. Yüksek, soğuk ve açıktı: Nereden geldiğine dair bir şey söylenmemişti; Duvarlardan çıkıyor gibiydi. Bir zamanlar emir verdiği yaratık gibi, orada yüzyıllardır uykuya yatmış olabilirdi.
es: Pero el final de la frase quedó ahogado por otra voz que resonó en todo el comedor. Era una voz aguda, fría y clara, y parecía provenir de las mismas paredes. Se diría que llevaba siglos ahí, latente, como el monstruo al que una vez ha-bía mandado.
vi_translation: But her last words were drowned out by another voice echoing throughout the Great Hall. That voice was high, cold, and clear. It was impossible to tell where the voice was coming from. It seemed to emanate from the very walls themselves. As if it had been sleeping there for centuries, like the monster it once controlled.
tr_translation: But her last words were drowned out by another voice echoing across the room. It was high, cold, and clear: Nothing was said about where it came from; it seemed to be emanating from the walls. Like the creature she once commanded, it could have been lying dormant there for centuries.
es_translation: But the end of the sentence was drowned out by another voice that echoed throughout the dining room. It was a sharp, cold, and clear voice, and it seemed to come from the very walls. One might say it had been there for centuries, latent, like the monster it had once commanded.

en: He had not meant to shout, but anger and panic were threatening to overwhelm him. He glanced at his watch as she hovered in front of him. It was a quarter to midnight.
vi: Nó không có ý quát, nhưng cơn giận và hoảng loạn đang có nguy cơ áp đảo nó. Nó liếc nhìn đồng hồ đeo tay trong khi con ma lờ lững trước mặt nó. Còn mười lăm phút nữa đến nửa đêm.
tr: Bağırmak istememişti, ama öfke ve panik onu dehşete düşürüyordu. Önünde süzülürken saatine bakıverdi, gece yarısına çeyrek vardı.
es: Harry no quería gritar, pero la rabia y el pánico amenazaban con apoderarse de él. Consultó su reloj mientras el fantasma permanecía suspendido ante él: eran las doce menos cuarto.
vi_translation: It didn't mean to shout, but the anger and panic were threatening to overwhelm it. It glanced at its wristwatch while the ghost floated lazily in front of it. Fifteen minutes left until midnight.
tr_translation: He hadn't meant to shout, but anger and panic were terrifying him. As he glided ahead, he glanced at his watch; it was a quarter to midnight.
es_translation: Harry didn't want to scream, but the rage and panic threatened to take over him. He checked his watch while the ghost hovered before him: it was a quarter to twelve.

en: “You are hardly the first student to covet the diadem.” she said disdainfully. “Generations of students have badgered me -”
vi: “Cậu không phải là học sinh đầu tiên thèm muốn vòng nguyệt quế,” bà nói một cách miệt thị, “nhiều thế hệ học sinh đã òn ỉ ta..”
tr: "Tacın peşine düşen ilk öğrenci sayılmazsın," dedi küçümseyerek. "Jenerasyonlar boyu öğrenciler beni rahatsız etti - "
